results.description:
May 14, 1-4:30pm
FRANK DAYKIN’s Fauré, Debussy, Ravel, Poulenc Master Class
The author of The Encyclopedia of French Song, Frank Daykin, will work with singers and pianists on the melodies of Fauré, Debussy, Ravel and Poulenc. This event is open to the public and shouldn’t be missed!

FRANK DAYKIN, PIANIST, is equally known as soloist, collaborative pianist, teacher, writer, and musicologist. His “The Encyclopedia of French Art Song: Fauré, Debussy, Ravel, Poulenc” was published (Pendragon Press, May 2013), and has been acquired by over 235 institutions of musical higher learning thus far. In it, he shares the wealth of his forty-plus years as a vocal coach and recital partner. Daykin was fortunate to have lived in the time of Bernac, Souzay, and Ameling, often accompanying their master classes in the US and abroad. For some years, he was the assistant of Thomas Grubb, the renowned French song expert, in all his classes at the Manhattan School of Music, working with over 60 singers weekly. Daykin writes a bi-weekly arts blog; and he is a classical reviewer for the New York Concert Review. Daykin has also had three volumes of poetry published, numerous
​selections having been set to music by contemporary composers. “Questions Remain: New Poems 2012/2013” (2014, CreateSpace), “Words Without Songs” (1992, Silver Hill Press), and “Islands” (1991, Silver Hill Press). Daykin is particularly identified with the French piano and chamber music repertoire, having performed the complete solo piano works of Ravel on Ravel’s own piano at the Ravel house/museum in France. His 35-year partnership with Millette Alexander in piano duo performance has produced two award-winning recordings and a host of performances in the US and abroad, always to rave reviews. He continues with numerous chamber groups including the Adelphi Chamber Players, Ambrosia Trio and Gotham Trio. Currently, he is on the faculty of the Chamber Music Conference/Composers Forum of the East at Bennington, VT. Decades of teaching experience have given him a fund of information that is always faithful to the music, while adding elements of humor and a supportive atmosphere that encourage learning. His master classes, in particular, often involve the spectators almost as much as the players.
results.how_to_find_us: Rehearsal Hall - 7th Floor
results.name: Frank Daykin's Debussy, Fauré, Ravel & Poulenc Master Class

results.description:
Hey everyone,

My friend Noelle, owner of the meetup group "Readers and Shakers NYC" is having a book swap and because I love a good swap, I thought it would be a great event for us to go to. Please join us on Saturday, May 14th from 1-3pm. This will be a great event for us to meet, hang out and have a great time (all while picking up some "new" free books) Here are the details...I hope to see you all there :)

Sam

Spring is upon us and I have something awesome for you to do with all those books you loved, but have been hoarding on your shelves, and in your closets & garages... swap those old stories for new adventures!

How it works: Everyone brings up to 10 books they're ready to part with; we mingle, pick out new-to-us books to take home, and the remainders get donated to a women's shelter or senior center (TBA)... everyone wins!

You will receive (1) ticket for each of your accepted books. Each ticket may be redeemed for (1) new-to-you book.  

Guidelines:

~Books for Young Adults (YA) and older are welcome. DO bring any type of fiction & literature. DO bring nonfiction titles (i.e. memoirs, biographies, cookbooks, self-help... books you would recommend to people you know). 

DO NOT bring children's, teen, academic/study aids, reference books, or magazines. I cannot list every genre here, but you get the idea; please use your best judgement.

~Books must be in good condition. Books that have missing or teared, stained, molded, covers or pages and/or have obscured words will not be accepted. Denied books will be returned to you; we cannot dispose of or donate them for you.

~This is a free event; however, you will be asked to make a suggested donation (of $1, $5, $10, etc.) when your books are collected (cash only). All proceeds will go to the women's shelter or senior center (TBA). Bringing at least one book is required to participate in the swap.
results.name: BOOK SWAP: "Spring Cleaning for Summer Reading (& Charity)

results.description:
Tournament Entry and Prizes


$3 entry. Bring exact change if possible. The Winner and Runner up will split the pot. 

Tournament Rules

- New Standard Format
- Best of 3 with 1 Ban, Conquest Elimination.
- You pick three classes.
- Your opponent bans 1. You must win a game with your two remaining classes. 
- You are not allow to change decks during the tournament. Must consistently use the same decks unless notified by tournament organizer.
- Disconnects will result in a loss for the person who disconnects unless he can prove/screenshot that he has lethal. 

BYOI (Bring Your Own Internet)
Whole foods have free internet but times out exactly every two hours from when you connect.  This may cause you to disconnect during a game and result with a loss. To avoid this, it's safer to use your own internet, play on your Phone or create a Hot Spot.   

Be on Time
Tournament will start at 1:20 pm and late comers will become spectators.

Location will be Wholefoods in Tribeca.  

We will be on the second floor of whole foods where all the dining tables are located.  You will need to walk to the far end of the first floor, past the cashiers to take the stairs or elevator up to the second floor.  Please ask the employees if you have trouble finding it.  

Once upstairs, look for members with laptops, tablets, or phones with Hearthstone. We are hoping to secure one of the long wooden tables to accommodate our group but there is also a board game meetup and knitting club that might be occupying the space. If the long wooden tables are unavailable, we'll go to the back where all the glass windows are and arrange some tables and chairs together.

Ideal train to get here is the A,C,E,2,3 at Chambers Street. It's about 2 blocks from there. This space has lots of seating, and free Wi-Fi. It will require repeated login to their whole foods network every two hours.  You can also bring your phones for more consistent internet. If someone have room in their bag, please bring a surge protector so we can share with laptop users.

*Consider purchasing food/drink at this location to help support their business as we are using their space.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

• Free Coaching available for anyone who wants to get better.
results.name: New "Standard" Hearthstone Tournament Fireside Gathering!

This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

Meet me in front of 400 W. 43rd Street, on the southwest corner of 9th Ave. I'll be sitting on the bench under the awning, if I'm lucky. (I'm a short red head, in case we haven't met before!) Please be on time!

You are free to roam around on your own any time after 11, but please DO meet us at 1:30. We'll stay on the 43rd St. corner until about 1:45 to give you time to get there. FYI: I do not  text, so cannot receive messages from you on Saturday. Perhaps another member can check online for any messages. 

After we meet, you can go off on your own, if you like, as some of you walk faster than others! It would be lovely to meet up when the entertainment starts, sometime in the afternoon. There will be one or more stages set up on 9th Avenue between 42nd and 57th Streets. Unfortunately, there is no written schedule to my knowledge, so we have to play it by ear. When we meet, we'll work out the details. Looking forward to meeting you all on Saturday.

I'm also changing the RSVP deadline: If you decide not to join us, please change your RSVP to "no" by tonight at 10:00 p.m. Thanks!

Regarding the food at the festival: Be sure to visit the Poseidon Bakery between 44th/45th Street, on the west side of 9th. Delicious spinach, veggie and meat pies, baklava and other delectable pastries. All is made in the store. It's an old family business.

See you tomorrow!

Anna

Join us for a fun event at Four Sisters Winery. Kick off your shoes and get ready for an unforgettable experience with some barefoot grape stomping! This event includes grape stomping, a formal wine tasting and a delicious Italian meal of spaghetti and meatballs with a tossed salad, bread, dessert, coffee and iced tea. Everyone also goes home with a wine class as a memento. The afternoon concludes with an educational wine cellar tour and a chance to sample the speciality dessert wines including a selection of fruit wines and one of the after dinner port-style wines.

The ticket price is $40.95 and includes the aforementioned activities, as well as tax and gratuity. To purchase your ticket, please call the winery at[masked]-3671. The owner advised calling and purchasing your ticket by April 10th because the grape stomping events sell out quickly! You must call ahead to purchase your ticket if you wish to attend the event. Also, when you call, it's important that you say that you are with Emily Urso's party in order for the group to sit together. Since the winery is an hour away, we can discuss carpooling. I would be willing to drive a few girls and let me know if anyone else would too. I looked forward to a fun day at the winery and hope you can join us!
results.name: Grape Stomping, Dinner & Wine Tasting!

results.description:
Shamanic Practitioner, Danielle Wilkinson, will briefly introduce you to the ancient spiritual practice of Shamanism. Shamanism is the earliest spiritual practice known to humankind. It is a universal practice. that has been and is still practiced all over the world.
In this workshop Danielle Wilkinson will lead you on your own personal shamanic journey. The shamanic journey is a core practice in all shamanic cultures. Shamanic journeying is a ritual performed to help us improve our own health and well-being. Journeying and other Shamanic practices introduce us to ways of living a more conscious life. These rituals also give us a foundation of how to be in service to the planet.
Shamans use monotonous sounds to alter consciousness during journeying. This ritual is typically done with some form of percussion: drumming & rattling. Scientific research shows us that when we are in an ordinary state of consciousness, our brainwaves are what are called in a beta state. When we listen to the sounds of drums, rattles, whistling sticks, didgeridoo, click sticks, chanting, bowls, etc. our brainwaves start to slow down out of an ordinary state of consciousness. Our brainwaves first go into what's called an alpha state. As we continue the journey, our brainwaves slow down even more and we go into a theta state. The theta state is where the shaman and the participant in the journey has access into something we call the invisible realms.
Some people call the invisible realms non-ordinary reality. In these realms we have access to helping spirits, messages and information and methods of healing for ourselves, humanity and our planet. We are all connected by an invisible web. Any form of healing we partake in in turn assists in healing the collective.
Danielle Wilkinson will guide you as you embark on this beautiful journey of freedom and peace through guided meditation and shamanic journey. You will be guided to meet your Power Animal helping spirit. Your Power Animal will lead the way on the rest of your journey to healing. This is a very powerful experience that will help transform your life and guide you to a path to inner transformation.
We will end with 30 mins of Crystal Chakra Sound Bowls by Brenda Castano.
Requirements: bring a journal or paper and pen

$30 Cash or pay in advance PayPal: [masked]
results.name: Journey for Healing with Sound

>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

DISCOVER A LONDON SQUARE IN MANHATTAN ON OUT PROFESSIONALS’ NEWEST WALKING TOUR AND MIXER.

On Saturday afternoon, May 14, you are invited to join Members and friends of Out Professionals for “Gramercy Park: The Walking Tour and Mixer.” Citing the exclusive park’s evocation of a London Square, Charlotte Devree once called it “A Victorian gentleman who has refused to die.” After exploring the Gramercy Park Historic District, we adjourn to Pete’s Tavern (1864), which remained open during Prohibition in the guise of a flower shop.

In 1831, as he saw the City expanding northward, Samuel Ruggles, developer and urban design visionary, purchased a piece of marshland from a descendant of Peter Stuyvesant. Ruggles then saw to the creation of Irving Place and Lexington Avenue, creating a private square as the new neighborhood’s center. Before the Civil War, the square’s Quaker Meeting House (now the Brotherhood Synagogue) served as an Undergound Railroad station.

The area surrounding Manhattan’s only private park soon became home to some of America's greatest inventors, architects, actors, doctors, diarists, publishers, writers, artists and presidential candidates.

Tour highlights include:

• The National Arts Club, created in Aesthetic Movement style by Calvert Vaux, architect of Central Park.

• The Players, the clubhouse where Mark Twain played pool and Sarah Bernhardt found herself trapped in an elevator.

• “The Bachelors” — noted interior designer Elsie de Wolfe (far left) and theater producer Elizabeth Marbury (near left).

• The lair of O’Henry, immortalized for his short story “The Gift of the Magi,” written in a booth at Pete’s Tavern.

• Homes of inventor Peter Cooper, architect Stanford White (right), and famed Shakespearean actor Edwin Booth.

Out Professionals’ private Walking Tour/Mixer series is designed for us — and you — by Joyce Gold History Tours of New York. Joyce teaches Manhattan history at New York University and the New School.

WHAT’S UP
Tour begins at 2 p.m. sharp, rain or shine. We meet at Gramercy Park, Lexington Avenue and East 21st Street. Subway: 6 to 23rd Street or 4/5/L/N/Q/R to Union Square (a 15-minute walk). Open-ended mixer about 4 p.m. at Pete’s Tavern, Irving Place at East 18th Street; refreshments on your own.

ADMISSION
Nonmember, $25. Dues-paying OP Member, just $15. Advance registration closes at 11 p.m. on Friday, May 13. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! The personalized nature of our tours requires limiting the number of participants. At the door, if available, cash only.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!
A 12-month individual Out Professionals Membership (new or renewal) PLUS admission for one to “Gramercy Park: The Walking Tour and Mixer” is yours for just $75. And remember, this buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Tour the Gramercy Park Neighborhood!

results.description:
We did this tour with our assistant a while ago and so we are doing it again. Please only RSVP if you are 100% certain that you can go.

Where: City Hall Park by the Fountain
Location: 52 Chambers 
Time: 2 pm (don't be late)
Max People: 90
Cost: FREE

Level: ALL

What to wear: Dress to be out and about walking
What to bring: Your camera

What's included?
- An amazing day out
- Learning a bit about your camera
- Meeting new friends

How will it work? 
    We start at City Hall Park (located at City Hall obviously), by the fountain. The fountain is quite photogenic as well as the by Text-Enhance">flowers, monuments and art work located throughout the park. We will stay there for about 30 minutes and then move on to our next spot. If you notice that everyone is gone, head over to the next location.

  Our next stop is  St. Paul's courtyard and take some pictures of the grave sites as well as memorials. This will be a leisurely stroll lasting approximately 20 minutes as we walk about 4 blocks to our next site  2:50 pm - our next location is Trinity church and take pictures along the block and behind the church. Alexander Hamilton's grave is located here (His face is on the $10 bill)

  Across the street is the New York by Text-Enhance">Stock Exchange and Federal Hall where we will stay for about 10 minutes. 

 
  Bowling Green Park to rest up and snap a few pictures (the train station structure is quite photogenic, statues across the street, interesting architecture, etc...)

  short distance away is The Sphere in Battery Park 

Castle Clinton will be our next stop, the Korean War Memorial is located inside.

The final destination is the shoreline of Battery Park facing the by Text-Enhance">Statue of liberty in the distance and boats sailing off. just remember, the entire tour is just over 1 mile and will last approximately 2 hrs. We will not wait for stragglers so if you want to stay with the group, adhere to the time schedule. (Note: if you want to linger at a favorite location, feel free to photograph a little more and catch up with us later) Also, there are a number of other sites to see along the route (Woolworth bldg, St. Paul church yard, etc...) Hope to see you there.

This is the Meeting spot City Hall Park Fountain

results.description:
Hey everyone. This month we'll be discussing All the Birds in the Sky by Charlie Jane Anders: 

From the editor-in-chief of io9.com, a stunning novel about the end of the world--and the beginning of our future

Childhood friends Patricia Delfine and Laurence Armstead didn't expect to see each other again, after parting ways under mysterious circumstances during middle school. After all, the development of magical powers and the invention of a two-second time machine could hardly fail to alarm one's peers and families.

But now they're both adults, living in the hipster mecca San Francisco, and the planet is falling apart around them. Laurence is an engineering genius who's working with a group that aims to avert catastrophic breakdown through technological intervention. Patricia is a graduate of Eltisley Maze, the hidden academy for the world's magically gifted, and works with a small band of other magicians to secretly repair the world's every-growing ailments. Little do they realize that something bigger than either of them, something begun years ago in their youth, is determined to bring them together--to either save the world, or plunge it into a new dark ages.

A deeply magical, darkly funny examination of life, love, and the apocalypse.

Sadly I will be unable to run the event. Becky Spurr will take over hosting duties for this session. You will also be picking a classic genre novel for our next read.
results.how_to_find_us: We're the nerds in the back.
results.name: Book Club: All The Birds in the Sky by Charlie Jane Anders

results.description:
Tibetan Lama Pai kung fu is an uncharacteristic martial art akin to standard Shaolin martial arts. Basic components of Tibetan Lama Kung Fu include:


Lau Sing Kyuhn (Shooting Star Fists or Comet Hands) - Tibetan martial Arts are known for their powerful strikes and kicks thrown at all angels and without chambering. The style uses waist power to generate force and in conjunction with throws and sweeps to make a complete fighting style.

Fei Hok Sau (Flying Crane Hands) - The style employs seizing with fingers for neutralizing opponents to render a limb unusable and to rip and gouge.

Neih Lok Sau (Maitreya Buddha Hand) - Wrenching limbs and attacking vital points to set up opponents for finishing moves.

Doh Loh Sau (Cotton Needle Hands) - Internal aspect of Lama Kung Fu that employs Tai Chi like moves to cultivate and develop the energy for external Kung Fu movements.

A class will entail: 
• Basic movements done in standing and moving positions. 
• Partner drills for self Defense application with and without equipment. 
• Form practice to learn movements and develop coordination, balance, speed and power.

All this is done in a serious, but fun learning environment. 

This first class is free. We meet up at 2 PM with the class running from 2:15pm to 3:45 PM. Please were comfortable clothing and light sneakers. Come out and try it! You might find there is a Lamaist deep inside you.
results.name: Basic Tibetan Lama Pai Kung Fu Practice

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT. 

IF YOU DON'T LIKE TO STOP IN A NUMBER OF ARTIST STUDIOS, THEN THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU. THIS WALK IS ABOUT 2 1/2 MILES AND MODERATE PACED. YOU WILL ALSO HAVE PLENTY OF TIME TO SOCIALIZE WITH OTHERS. 

I also have scheduled this same walk on Sunday, May 15th.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo.

Description:  Now in its 20th year, TOAST (Tribeca Open Artist Studio Tour) artists will open their doors to the public and show their work. The artists don’t charge admission to their art studios. We’ll stop in some of these art studios and get a rare, intimate view of the artists’ working environment. We can talk to the artists about what they do. Some of the art studios are in 19th century tenement buildings, old industrial buildings, and cast iron structures. This art walk features painting, photography, ceramics, mixed-media, sculpture, printmaking, and dress making and designing.  

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer’s Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time/Place:  The meeting time is (after lunch) at 2:00 PM. The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Barnes & Noble Bookstore at 97 Warren Street in the Tribeca neighborhood. Before the walk, restrooms are available in Barnes & Noble or Bed Bath & Beyond (Both have the same building entrance.)

Transportation Options:  Take the 1, 2, or 3 subway train to Chambers Street, which is about two blocks away, or take the A or C subway train to Chambers Street, which is about three blocks away.

Finishing Time/Place:  The walk will finish between 5:00 PM and 5:15 PM somewhere in the Tribeca neighborhood.

Only heavy rain or rain with windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is heavy rain or rain with windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning (before 10:00 AM). If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If it is raining, I will just bring an umbrella. (We will be spending half the time inside these artist studios anyway. Plus, this event is held only once a year, so there is no rain date to reschedule it.)

Below are figure sculptures by Nancy B. Pantirer.

Below are paintings by C.J. Collins.

Below are paintings by Judy Somerville.
results.name: Tribeca Artist Studio Walk (May 14)

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: 226 Rome Street, Newark, NJ  Map: http://g.co/maps/ueppk

Boy, was I wrong!

Real millionaire affiliates know that there's absolutely no way to sustain affiliate marketing success without having some sort of go-to network/mastermind that has been cultivated over time.

Start building yours with your very own New York City crew, including yours truly."

Learn why affiliates get held back so much.  What causes them to see great heights and then fizzle out never to be heard from again.  Learn why the best affiliates aren't the ones who are geniuses, but genius NETWORKERS.

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Please join us for an exciting gallery tour at Lori Bookstein Fine Art located in the heart of Chelsea's gallery district just steps away from Chelsea Market and the Highline.

In addition to lending her scholarly perspective on contemporary art, Lori Bookstein, Founder and President of Lori Bookstein Fine Art, will also share her philosophy for building and shaping a collection. Lori Bookstein will lead a guided tour of "Paul Resika: Recent Paintings" and "Diana Horowitz: Italian Landscapes." The exhibitions will remain on view through June 4, 2016. The opening reception will be held on Thursday, April 28, 6 to 8 P.M.

About Lori Bookstein Fine Art
Lori Bookstein Fine Arts exhibits Twentieth and Twenty-first Century American Art, with a focus on American Modernism and the second generation of the New York School. The gallery currently represents seventeen contemporary artists, ranging from emerging to established.

About Diana Horowitz
Diana Horowitz is a contemporary Brooklyn artist who works within the tradition of open-air painting prominent in the 17th and 18th century. Her works depict the unromantic modern constructions in the New York City in a surreal and tranquil manner. Her works are included in the permanent collection of Brooklyn Museum of Arts, Museum of the City of New york and others.

About Paul Resika
Paul Resika is an American painter born and raised in New York City. He chaired the Parson School of Design MFA program from 1978-1990. His works are in the permanent collection of world-class museums such as the Metropolitan Museum of Arts and the Museum of Modern Art.

Hello All,

I hope to extend the invitation for you all to join the Swedish group this year who organizes a fun Eurovision Song Contest viewing party.

Eurovision Song Contest live from Sweden Saturday, May 14, 2015

Tonic Sports Bar 727 Seventh Ave (48th Street)

Come early for better seating, but the party starts at 2:30pm


Just like every year, join the Swedish group at Tonic! This years Eurovison Song Contest hosted by several European expat groups here in NYC. 

Last year it was a packed event. Join the biggest group of Swedes cheering all the way from New York!


Not sure who is favorite to win.... Comment below!

This is a live viewing of Europe's favorite television show (streaming live via internet)! If you grew up in Europe there's no need to explain. Before American Idol there was Eurovision. Since 1956, the Contest has been broadcast every year and is one of television's longest running music shows. It is one of the most watched non-sporting events in the world. Featuring kitschy costumes and every style of music, love it or hate it ...the Contest represents a broad cross section of European culture unmatched by any other event.


Tonic Sports Bar 727 Seventh Ave (48th Street) @2:30pm MULTIPLE HUGE SCREENS!

This is an all ages event. Anyone is invited to attend - bring friends!

Disclaimer: Although we don't anticipate any issues, since the event will be streaming live from the internet we may experience intermittent outages, poor image or sound quality and/or technical problems.

There will be no cover for this event. Just pay for what you drink/eat. Tables are first come first served.

Bi-Perspective is the longest-running social, discussion and support group for ALL bisexual/non-monosexual, queer-identified and questioning people meeting in the New York City area.

Monthly meetings are held on the 1st Saturday of every month from 2:30 PM to 4:00 PM at the LGBT Community Center, followed by a convivial Coffee & Desert at a nearby local restaurant. The group provides a warm & friendly, welcoming, caring, SAFE, non-discriminatory environment for everyone who lives, works or plays in the New York City area.

Come visit and share your Feelings, Hopes and Dreams as well as your Fears, Concerns and Uncertainties with us. And of course, Joy and Laughter are always welcome at our meetings too! Bi-Perspective, a great way to meet others from the community and to make new friends in the New York area.

$5 (more if/less if) suggested donation to help defray room-rental cost

results.description:
Who is asking these questions ?

You and others who read this.

Ok, Thanks a lot for that!

No problem, it's nice doing empathy.

Is this free or donation based class ?


it's a donation based class.

I kept the group completely free for two years and paid all the organizer dues out of my pocket. Meetup is not really helping me to give free classes or with organizer fees-And it's not small, believe me- 

So the classes will be donation based starting from 2016

Will there be a yoga mat for me ? 

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket.Feel free to post a message below and hopefully someone would have an extra mat. 

Should i ask the organizer if he can arrange extra mats for me ?

Seriously ?

Oh, OK.I'm sorry. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.


Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 
Besides emergency situations members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group. 

What kind of yoga class this will be ?


It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. Umit will be helping you with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Great, how am i going to get there ? where do you guys meet ? 

LOCATION PICTURES ARE HERE(where we meet and practice): 

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26108446/
results.how_to_find_us: just get to the corner of 72nd and 5th. Take a close look at the benches on your left handside. We are there !!!

results.description:
We get together every other weekend and play jazz.

If you plan to join the group, the most important thing you can tell us is what instrument you play.

Before you sign up for a jam session, please check the RSVP list in the right-hand column. If we already have 3 guitarists and 2 keyboard players, a drummer, and a bassist, then we don't need any more of those instruments. Sign up for another one.

This isn't a group for beginners. The songs we play can be harmonically and melodically complex. You need to have some proficiency with your instrument, although you may be new to jazz.

We strive to provide a place where musicians at different levels can come together and develop skills as jazz players. Toward that end, we do not tolerate anyone criticizing another's playing.

Bring a copy of The Real Book (sixth edition). Most of the songs we play are there. If you want to work on a song that's not in the book, you must bring lead sheets for everyone.

We'll be in one of the rooms at Music Makers, on the third floor. The address and directions are above. I'll usually let everyone know by Thursday which room we'll be in on Saturday. The rooms cost $72 for all three hours. We divide the cost equally.
results.how_to_find_us: It's between 7th and 8th avenues. Near the 1,2,3, A,C,E, B, and other trains. It's on the third floor.
results.name: Play Jazz!

results.description:
Political Correctness is generally defined as:


• the avoidance, often considered as taken to extremes, of forms of expression or action that are perceived to exclude, marginalize, or insult groups of people who are socially disadvantaged or discriminated against.

Has it gone too far? Has it morphed into a new social movement for the younger generation? 


Some say it enhances "social consciousness," while others proclaim that it's tantamount to thought control and a suppression of Free Speech.


What are your thoughts?


Have you witnessed, or been subject to, certain offensive or incendiary remarks, triggered by insensitivity or utter disrespect?

Or, have you been on the receiving end of what amounted to an overt, undue political correctness? 

If so, how do these experiences shape your views?


Also, in an ever-increasingly complex society, what is the proper and tolerable level of "cultural appropriation"? (e.g., the Redskins team logo).


Get ready for an intellectual "no-holds barred," yet civil discussion on this volatile subject. 

We will also discuss some recent controversial incidents of political correctness in Part II. 

There will be three parts:

Part I: a 30-minute debate between those for and against the PC culture.

Part II:  A quick lightening round of (in)famous statements and quotes, as well as some recent controversial incidents of political correctness.

Part III:  The regular group discussion begins -- people can raise any questions or concerns stemming from the debate, including the good, the bad, and the ugly.

--------------------------------------------

For those who wish to engage in pre-meetup online discussions, you can post your comments here.

http://www.nycpoliticalforum.org/content/05022016-205am/political-correctness-it-good-complexly-nuanced-or-bullsht
results.name: Political Correctness: is it Good, Complexly-Nuanced . . . or Bullsh*t ?

results.description:
Note: This Is the St. Barts Location.

Session #1 Sold Out & was a big Success so we've added Session #2.

At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackPeopleSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


(Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay using Venmo or Chase QuikPay to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 3pm. ST BART'S SWIMMING POOL

• 4/30/16; 5/7/16 ; 5/14/16; 5/21/16; 5/28/16(No Lesson); 6/4/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. 

Come June we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Max 2. Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315

What makes you happy?  

Kriss happily volunteered to host this meetup.  Thank you Kriss!  http://www.meetup.com/TEDxMeetup/events/230653131/

'Dan Gilbert, author of "Stumbling on Happiness," challenges the idea that we’ll be miserable if we don’t get what we want. Our "psychological immune system" lets us feel truly happy even when things don’t go as planned.' 

Join us in Bryant Park for fresh air, sun, and conversation.  

Share what makes you happy.   
--Greet old friends and meet new one.  

(***NOTE - This outdoor event is weather contingent. Please check back here after 8 a.m. on the morning of May 14th for the final status before departing for this meetup.  Thank you.***)

3:00 pm    Watch TED Talk on my laptop 

3:15 pm     Introductions

5:30 pm +  All are welcome to continue the conversation on your own. 

http://www.ted.com/talks/dan_gilbert_asks_why_are_we_happy 

(Please note that Gilbert is not scheduled to appear...only his video is scheduled. This event works like a book club, but the discussion topics are clips from Stumbling on Happiness, published in 2006, became a New York Times bestseller and has been translated into 20 languages. 

In fact, the title of his book could be drawn from his own life. At 19, he was a high school dropout with dreams of writing science fiction. When a creative writing class at his community college was full, he enrolled in the only available course: psychology. He found his passion there, earned a doctorate in social psychology in 1985 at Princeton, and has since won a Guggenheim Fellowship and the Phi Beta Kappa teaching prize for his work at Harvard. He has written essays and articles for The New York Times, Timeand even Starbucks, while continuing his research into happiness at his Hedonic Psychology Laboratory.

What others say

“Gilbert's elbow-in-the-ribs social-science humor is actually funny. ... But underneath the goofball brilliance, [he] has a serious argument to make about why human beings are forever wrongly predicting what will make them happy.” — New York Times Book Review '

About the "TEDxMeetup" Group Organizer: Yen is a parent, manager, and former educator & examiner in the public and private sector.  He chooses to be happy.

What makes you happy?


Kriss kindly volunteered to host this meetup. Thank you Kriss!

'Dan Gilbert, author of "Stumbling on Happiness," challenges the idea that we’ll be miserable if we don’t get what we want. Our "psychological immune system" lets us feel truly happy even when things don’t go as planned.'


Join us in Bryant Park for fresh air and conversation.


Share what makes you happy.
--Greet old friends and meet new one.

(***NOTE - This outdoor event is weather contingent. Please check back here after 8 a.m. on the morning of May 14th for the status of this event before departing. Thank you.***)

Proposed Agenda

3:00 pm Watch TED Talk on host's laptop


3:15 pm Introductions

5:30 pm + All are welcome to continue the conversation on your own.

http://www.ted.com/talks/dan_gilbert_asks_why_are_we_happy


(Please note that Gilbert is not scheduled to appear...only his video is scheduled. This event works like a book club, but the discussion topics are clips from <a>www.ted.com,</a> "Ideas Worth Spreading". )


(See photos of map of meetup location and tables outside Bryant Park Grill)

Dan Gilbert: 'Harvard psychologist Dan Gilbert says our beliefs about what will make us happy are often wrong — a premise he supports with intriguing research, and explains in his accessible and unexpectedly funny book, Stumbling on Happiness.

Why you should listen: Dan Gilbert believes that, in our ardent, lifelong pursuit of happiness, most of us have the wrong map. In the same way that optical illusions fool our eyes -- and fool everyone's eyes in the same way -- Gilbert argues that our brains systematically misjudge what will make us happy. And these quirks in our cognition make humans very poor predictors of our own bliss.

The premise of his current research -- that our assumptions about what will make us happy are often wrong -- is supported with clinical research drawn from psychology and neuroscience. But his delivery is what sets him apart. His engaging -- and often hilarious -- style pokes fun at typical human behavior and invokes pop-culture references everyone can relate to. This winning style translates also to Gilbert's writing, which islucid, approachable and laugh-out-loud funny. The immensely readable Stumbling on Happiness, published in 2006, became a New York Times bestseller and has been translated into 20 languages.

In fact, the title of his book could be drawn from his own life. At 19, he was a high school dropout with dreams of writing science fiction. When a creative writing class at his community college was full, he enrolled in the only available course: psychology. He found his passion there, earned a doctorate in social psychology in 1985 at Princeton, and has since won a Guggenheim Fellowship and the Phi Beta Kappa teaching prize for his work at Harvard. He has written essays and articles for The New York Times, Timeand even Starbucks, while continuing his research into happiness at his Hedonic Psychology Laboratory.

What others say

“Gilbert's elbow-in-the-ribs social-science humor is actually funny. ... But underneath the goofball brilliance, [he] has a serious argument to make about why human beings are forever wrongly predicting what will make them happy.” — New York Times Book Review '

About the Host: Kriss is a member of TEDxMeetup since April 1, 2016. Her favorite TED Talks are Jonathan HAIDT's, TED2008, "The moral roots of liberals and conservatives" and Jackson KATZ, TEDxFiDiWomen, "Violence & Silence" (filmed in Nov. 2012).

About the "TEDxMeetup" Group Organizer: Yen is a parent, manager, and former educator & examiner in the public and private sector. He chooses to be happy.
results.name: OUTSIDE BRYANT PARK GRILL Gilbert's 'Surprising Science of Happiness' Host:Kriss

results.description:
Click Here for a Free Online Webinar: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation- 

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful. 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor.
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation--FREE Class (Online Webinar)

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

The Sword Coast is under siege. In an audacious bid for power, the Cult of the Dragon, along with its dragon allies and the Red Wizards of Thay, seeks to free Tiamat from her prison in the Nine Hells to bring her to the Forgotten Realms. The cult's forces are sweeping from town to town, laying waste to all who oppose them and gathering a hoard of riches for their dread queen. The threat is so dire, factions as disparate as the Harpers and the Zhentarim are banding together to battle the cult. Never before has the need for heroes been as desperate.

Players of all walks, new and old, are always welcome. Please feel free to comment if you have any questions.

Please join us for this week's sit at 4pm this afternoon at B'nai Keshet (99 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair), where a small but dedicated group is practicing mindfulness meditation in a Jewish context every Shabbat. There is a beauty and peacefulness when we sit together as a group and support each other's ability to practice.  


The sit leaders alternate each week.  


We frequently begin with a chant, followed by two separate sits with kavvanot (intentions) inspired by the calendar, the weekly Torah portion or our daily lives. All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com

No called balls/strikes.  You get three swings to put the ball into play.

No taking leads.

Game is capped at 24 to ensure those that sign up will get a lot of playing time and at-bats.

First game free.

The A Train:

Walk 4 blocks North on Broadway to 215th Street on the West side of the street. I am the first building just past 215th Street. (Just North of the Deli - Between 215th and 216th Streets)

results.name: D.W.W.A.C. MEETING!!!!!!

results.description:
What does Giving mean to you? What are the various forms of Giving and how has that affected your happiness and/or that of others, directly and indirectly? How connected are you to what you have given to yourself, to family and friends, your company, your country, your environment, to society as a whole? How might that connection level affect the frequency and depth of your giving in all your years to come? How has GIVING and how has being GIVEN to changed and shaped your life?

This Saturday we'll be having a fairly wide range of discussion on the many, many ways that we give to others AND ourselves and how that affects our happiness levels. Let's talk and "give" ;) numerous examples exploring how we have given (looking back) in addition to how we continue to give our time, money/physical resources, intangible resources, mind/focus/attention, heart/spirit/affection, respect, dedication, (any noun), and the list goes on and on...Later in the conversation or over dinner, we'll discuss how we might give to others and ourselves differently, so as to ultimately increase our collective value and experience of life.

The concept of "Giving" is quite vast and has many levels to it so I greatly look forward to discussing with all of you. Any and all thoughts are welcome on the subject beyond the simple description above.

Note: this is not a support group for those sad or depressed as there are other domains set up for that purpose. Please do not attend if you feel or rationalize that others somehow have the responsibility of cheering you up, directly or indirectly.

A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George, Priyo, & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

Look for our red Meetup Sign.

The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005. 21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

<a href="http://internal.psychology.illinois.edu/%7Eediener/Documents/Diener-Suh-Lucas-Smith_1999.pdf">Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
We're bringing back our popular format this month here at BFTVC: All Full Court Evening. We'll have 3 teams of 7, with two subs, and rotate the teams around to play full court games all evening.

And as usual:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Walls, and ceiling are out of bounds. 


3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will be drawing our own legendary weaponry, pretty self explanatory as the focus is to design the most interesting, unique, cool, badass, or epic weapons you can possibly conceive!

The meetup will be split into three parts: First a half hour of warm-up drawings followed by a break of conceptual discussion, then after an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others fully developed drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Amy Heckerling's adaptation of Cameron Crowe's Fast Times at Ridgemont High is often considered one of the finest films of a disreputable genre (the teen sex comedy), and kick-started the careers of many future stars. The center of this ensemble film is Jennifer Jason Leigh as Stacy Hamilton. She is a young, innocent high-school student who, as the film opens, is asking for advice from her friend, the sexually outspoken Linda Barrett (Phoebe Cates). Stacy takes a liking to nebbish Mark Ratner (Brian Backer), but he is too afraid to make a move even after Stacy all but throws herself at him. She eventually hooks up with Mark's more confident best friend, Mike Damone (Robert Romanus). When not concerning itself with these four characters, the film spends time with stoned surfer dude Jeff Spicoli (Sean Penn) and his ongoing feud with history teacher Mr. Hand (Ray Walston). The film includes brief appearances by such future stars as Nicolas Cage, Eric Stoltz, and Forest Whitake

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vzva_I8WPAg

This will sell out, get your tix here: http://metrograph.com/film/film/147/fast-times-at-ridgemont-high

Hopefully someone will film it and take a lot of pics. I will not be at this, I will be at the Hudson Horror Show in Poughkeepsie.

results.description:
All registrants  must have a college degree and work in Manhattan.


Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off other select events from our calendar (wine tastings, boat cruises, speeddating, advanced degree events, fireman parties.) Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
The Book: Specimen Days by Michael Cunningham

From 1999 Pulitzer Prize winner for fiction (The Hours) is Cunningham's novel, Specimen Days, following the literary form of three characters in three separate time periods of past, present and future centered around a literary piece. This book's Mrs. Dalloway is Walt Whitman's Leaves of Grass. (Yes, I felt would be a nice segue from our last meetup's poetry centric theme!)

The big city in this literary work is New York and Cunningham takes you through its evolution from a legendary fire during the industrial revolution ("In the Machine") to today's post 9/11 terrorism centric ("The Children's Crusade") then finally to a futuristic New York ("Like Beauty") where muggings in Central Park are a tourist attraction. 

The Whiskey: Monkey Shoulder


One of my personal favorites, Monkey Shoulder blended scotch comprised of three different Single Malts - Glenfiddich, Balvenie and Kininvie. 

From their official site, drinking Monkey Shoulder is like "riding bareback on the wild moors of Scotland with a flame haired maiden on Christmas morning" or "007 wearing a tuxedo suit". For the whisky note traditionalist, it's "zesty orange meets mellow vanilla, honey and spiced oak."


The Bar: Whiskey Park

Voted one of the 5 best bars near Central Park and from the Gerber Group's Whiskey Park remains "the area's most popular watering hole with the perfect mix of elegance and action". (From their FB page)

*Fun trivia: Mrs. Dalloway was published on May 14, 1925
results.how_to_find_us: We will have a reserved area
results.name: Specimen Days + Monkey Shoulder

results.description:
Note: YorkShire Towers Location

Session #1 Sold Out & was a big Success so we've added Session #2.

At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackPeopleSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


(Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay using Venmo or Chase QuikPay to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 5pm. YORKSHIRE TOWERS (UES)

• 4/30/16; 5/7/16 ; 5/14/16; 5/21/16; 5/28/16(No Lesson); 6/4/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. 

Come June we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Max 2. Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315

results.description:
And the winner by a fairly significant margin is Captain America: Civil War. The breakdown of votes is as follows:

Captain America: Civil War- 18

The Huntsman: Winter War- 6

Keanu- 3

Ratchet & Clank- 1


We'll be catching the 6:45pm showing of Captain America: Civil War at the AMC Loews 34th Street 14 theater, so that means we'll be meeting at 6:15pm in the lobby of the theater. We'll be eating after the movie at the Skylight Diner, about a block away from the theater. The food is decent and the service can be charmingly rude, but they seat huge groups easily, so we continue our humble patronage with them.

After the dinner, for those who simply don't wish the evening to end, we'll head to a nearby bar to continue with our stimulating and intellectual discourse- or just keep talking and stuff.
results.name: Dinner and a Movie- Captain America: Civil War

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
We had a success with previous movie-meetup for "Zootopia", and I'd like to suggest new one - meetup for "Captain America: Civil War"! 

"Civil War" will release at May 6, but I've just looked the weather, and on 8th will be raining, and I think that 14th May is better, because there will be 71 degrees F and a few clouds.  

The movie time is 6:30. The movie is 2 hour 28 minutes long. But I think that it's better to meet there for 15-20 earlier. 


We will all get together at the main entrance. If you plan on getting your ticket in the theater, please come early to account for the time it takes to purchase a ticket. 

After the movie, we can always find a place to eat and hang out around there also.

In order for us to organize to sit as close together as possible, you can order and reserve a seat for the theater in the website below.

HOW TO BUY A TICKET: 

1) Click on this link: http://www.regmovies.com/Movies/Movie-Folder/2016/Captain-America-Civil-War-185792

2) Choose Saturday 14 as day of the movie. If needed set our location (850 Broadway, New York, NY 10003).

3) We will take regular one, so it will be first section.

4) Click on time that we need (for example 6PM).

5) New site appears. Choose ticket that you need and how many you need. Adults tickets cost $16 per 1. 

6) Then click "Buy Tickets".

7) New page appears. You need to Log in\Sign in or check out as a guest. Then you need to type your e-mail for receipt.

8) After that choose your payment method, type your payment info. Then click "Complete My Purchase". Don't forget unsubscribe from e-mail update (advertising from cinema). It's a check-box in the bottom of that page.

I bought 2 tickets for 6:30PM.

But I think that it's better to meet there for 15-20 earlier. So let it be 6:10-6:15. 


UPD: We will go to  Regal Cinemas Union Square 14 at 850 Broadway, New York, NY 10003 because there is won't be "Captain" at AMC 7.  Sorry for that (if you wanted AMC), I was shocked too. :)
results.name: Captain America: Civil War - Meetup

results.description:
Den här månaden träffas vi på en restaurang eller krog med bra läge på Manhattan eller Brooklyn. När meetup-platsen är bestämd kommer du att få e-post med platsdetaljer.

Om du vill komma på vår Happy Hour så registrera dig gärna på väntelistan! Om du kan delta i samtal på svenska eller norska utan att prata på engelska, så är möjligheten väldigt stor att du kommer få en plats. (Vårt mål är inte prata engelska innan 8.30 pm.) 

Observera att de flesta i gruppen ar antingen svenskar eller norrman eller personer som talar svenska eller norska sa om du kommer for att fa tala danska, var beredd pa att det eventuellt inte ar sa manga danskar dar. 

Eftersom vi pratar svenska, norska och danska pa vara traffar antas bara medlemmar som har atminstone grundlaggande kunskaper i nagot av de skandinaviska spraken.

Vänligen OSA respektfullt. Vi är en verklig grupp av vänner och våra etikettsregler återspeglar detta. Om du inser att du inte kan komma, vilket är helt ok, så se till att du uppdaterar din OSA.

results.description:
Hey Everyone!

Our last MeetUp at One Mile House was awesome! It was good to see old and new faces—we think it might have been our best turn out yet! We'll be doing our next event at City Hops (formerly Miso Hoppy) at 1145 2nd Ave (between 60th and 61st) in the Upper East Side. This will be the first time we're having a MeetUp at City Hops, a new tap room and bottle shop that opened a few months ago.

We'll have a VERY special keg for the evening Alemsmith's Hammerhead Speedway Coffee Stout and attendees will get 10% off.


PLEASE NOTE: City Hops is a small shop so we will be limiting the number of RSVPs. If you RSVP "Yes" please come! Otherwise you might be preventing someone else from coming.


Looking forward to seeing you all! And if you can't make this event, we'll be doing another soon!

Cheers!

Andrew
