results.description:
Grab your glow sticks, bedazzle your bike, put on your craziest outfit, blast some party tunes and be ready for sensory overload at the Brooklyn Bike Rave, a night ride along the Brooklyn Waterfront Greenway.

On Saturday, May 14th, hundreds of cyclists will ride en masse along 7.5 miles of the Brooklyn Waterfront Greenway. Starting in Greenpoint, the group will ride through Williamsburg, travel inside the Brooklyn Navy Yard, through DUMBO and Brooklyn Bridge Park and loop back to finish under the iconic Archway under the Manhattan Bridge in DUMBO.

The Bike Rave is a cultural phenomenon that is spreading around the world, altering how people think about the cities in which they live and we invite you to join us for the city’s first! (from the BrooklynGreenway.org website)

You must register for this event in order to participate. Registration is at http://www.brooklyngreenway.org/event/brooklyn-bike-rave/. Tickets are currently $47 and may increase as the event date approaches.

Date: Saturday, May 14, 2016
Time: 7:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Meeting place and time: TBD after the bike rave organizer announces the starting point

Note:
* Helmets are required.
* Alcohol is not allowed.
* Bring portable speakers if you have them along with your smartphone to synchronize with the event's playlist. More info about this will be sent after registration. For more information about the Brooklyn Bike Race go to http://www.brooklyngreenway.org/event/brooklyn-bike-rave/

For more information about bike raves in general check out https://momentummag.com/the-bike-rave-a-game-changer/
results.name: Brooklyn Bike Rave!

results.description:
Dear Buddies, 

How cool would it be to be able to practice the language of your interest on a daily basis, whether that's your mother language or the language you're trying to learn. Interacting through messenger chats is a good way of networking, exchanging information and get to practice your language. 

What languages are available? We're already running group chat rooms in Spanish, English, Korean, French and Japanese~ For any other language, we'll start a new chat room and invite others to join you.  

What level of fluency is required? All levels are welcome to join us. If you're just getting started, you'll get the opportunity of seeing how other people chat with each other. 

Why Kakaotalk messenger? Our first meetup group is based in Seoul so all our members use Kakaotalk. For you it may be the first time using it but certainly may be of great help in getting you immersed in this global network!

Is this open 24x7? Yes, it's a group chat room in Kakaotalk so you can stop by anytime of the day and participate!

How to  be invited to the room? Add my id fromchile and tell us which language you want to practice. 

For any questions you may have, you can reach us at Kakaotalk id fromchile or email address [masked]. 

Johncito
results.how_to_find_us: Add my id fromchile on Kakaotalk and let us know your language of interest~
results.name: Let's Practice your Language in Group Chat Rooms on Kakaotalk Messenger!

results.description:
A Special Interest Group for everything robotics. Come be part of our current group project, a balancing robot. Do you need help with a current robotics project? Well, bring it in and we'll see what we can do. Do you have a robot you'd like to show off? We'd love to see it. All types of robots are welcome, including walking, rolling, and dancing. Dancing robots especially, we'd love to see that. We meet every 2nd Saturday of the month to build, fix, program, and just talk about robots.

results.description:
Hey Student Leaders!

This is our 3rd networking event for Student Leaders in North New Jersey! It's amazes me the requests I'm getting to continue hosting more and more of these events, and honestly, I see great things in our future that will come out from these events! The purpose for this event is to create connections between different student leaders in the north Jersey area. Think of this event as a similar networking event the SGA or the office Student Life hosts in your university. The difference between this event and the networking event in your university is that we'll have different student leaders from different universities at this event. This event will be ran in an unconference style. Overall, what this means is that we will have discussion based sessions where you guys (Student Leaders) will bring the topics you would like to talk about, and we'll all give our opinions, suggestions, and comments on the topic. Sample topics would be the following:

1. How to publicize for an event

2. How to recruit new members

3. How to deal with a lazy Eboard member

4. How to effectively train new eboard members Get me? In the education field, they have these unconference events where different educators come together to gain and share knowledge about any topics regarding education; they are called edcamps. We are essentially using that same model, but we'll focus on topics that relate to student-ran organizations. Check out the video below to get an idea of what an unconference event looks like. Edcamp Video

Agenda for the event

Welcome (Mingle over light refreshments) 7:00pm

Introduction of Inspimind (Network of College Student Leaders) 7:15pm

Student Leaders Ice Breaker 7:25pm

Edcamp Video 7:35pm Edcamp (Student Leader version) 7:40pm

Closing remarks 8:40pm

9:00pm Adjournment Registration for event (Click here to register to attend the event!) Questions? Send me a message! -Wilfredo Betance Jr
results.name: Student Leader Networking event!

Join us for Saturday night Sichuan at Legend 72 in the Upper West Side.  

Dinner will be family-style.  Everyone will pay an equal share of the final food bill, including tax and tip, and pay an additional $1 toward the Meetup Organizer dues.  (It is free to be a Meetup member, but not to be a Meetup organizer.)  Cash only.  Estimated cost per person is $28-33.  You will pay for your own drinks and individual desserts, if any.  

Only RSVP if you plan to attend.  If your plans change, please update your RSVP to Not Going. 

Do not RSVP if you do not want to eat real spicy Sichuan food. 

By attending, you agree to be responsible for your own dietary restrictions, allergies, health and general welfare.

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by over a dozen different Singles groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off other select events from our calendar (wine tastings, boat cruises, speeddating, advanced degree events, fireman parties.) Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.
results.name: The Best Singles Happy Hour in NYC Match Live Meets Speeddating - 125+ Prepaid

results.description:
Join 100+ members already prepaid for this fun singles party. Mix and mingle with other single Meetup members and find your match! It's a great way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience!   

We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people in a friendly & flirty way. The atmosphere is casual & relaxed so you can interact with others without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. 

*GET TICKETS HERE

*Prepay Only Event. NO tickets sold at door. 

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

What members can expect: 

• Comp Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials All Night!

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Music played at conversational levels

*GET TICKETS HERE

*$15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer. No tix sold at door. 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite friends to join you. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? No but will cater mostly to 20's-40's. It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

How many will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  Based on presages and RSVPs outside of this group, we expect 100+ members to attend. 

MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/May-14-2016_at_0800PM

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the  8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you  NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you  EXPERIENCED DANCERS , there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor

(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 4 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: Ask desk to direct you to your Organizers: Lori & Cindi
results.name: "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party at Club 412

results.description:
Join 100+ members already prepaid for this fun singles party. Mix and mingle with other single Meetup members and find your match! It's a great way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience!   

We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people in a friendly & flirty way. The atmosphere is casual & relaxed so you can interact with others without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. 

*GET TICKETS HERE

*Prepay Only Event. NO tickets sold at door. 

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

What members can expect: 

• Comp Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials All Night!

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Music played at conversational levels

*GET TICKETS HERE

*$15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer. No tix sold at door. 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite friends to join you. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? No but will cater mostly to 20's-40's. It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

How many will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  Based on presages and RSVPs outside of this group, we expect 100+ members to attend. 

MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/May-14-2016_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.name: Singles Mingle Mixer (Comp Apps, Drink Specials, Icebreakers) Prepay Only

results.description:
Join 100+ members already prepaid for this fun singles party. Mix and mingle with other single Meetup members and find your match! It's a great way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience!   

We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people in a friendly & flirty way. The atmosphere is casual & relaxed so you can interact with others without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. 

*GET TICKETS HERE

*Prepay Only Event. NO tickets sold at door. 

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

What members can expect: 

• Comp Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials All Night!

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Music played at conversational levels

*GET TICKETS HERE

*$15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer. No tix sold at door. 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite friends to join you. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? No but will cater mostly to 20's-40's. It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

How many will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  Based on presages and RSVPs outside of this group, we expect 100+ members to attend. 

MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/May-14-2016_at_0800PM

results.description:
Join 100+ members already prepaid for this fun singles party. Mix and mingle with other single Meetup members and find your match! It's a great way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience!   

We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people in a friendly & flirty way. The atmosphere is casual & relaxed so you can interact with others without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. 

*GET TICKETS HERE

*Prepay Only Event. NO tickets sold at door. 

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

What members can expect: 

• Comp Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials All Night!

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Music played at conversational levels

*GET TICKETS HERE

*$15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer. No tix sold at door. 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite friends to join you. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? No but will cater mostly to 20's-40's. It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

How many will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  Based on presages and RSVPs outside of this group, we expect 100+ members to attend. 

MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/May-14-2016_at_0800PM

Lexington's Lounge at The Cort Hotel is a classy, sophisticated and upscale lounge without the attitude!  It is one of our favorite gathering spots in the city! Please join us for this special night out will get to meet other members and friends  in a comfortable and casual atmosphere.  We'll have staff on hand to welcome you and live DJ music played at conversational levels beginning at 9pm.

Here is what to expect:

-Doors open at 8pm

-Our staff will be at the check in table ready to greet you and introduce you to others at the party.

-We'll have a few fun games for you to participate in between 8:30-9:30pm that will get you up and around meeting even more people in the group.

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Live DJ plays chill out retro lounge music from 9pm-1am

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending show up on their own.

Dress code: keep it neat.  Please no sneakers or t-shirts

Is there food available?  Yes, they have an awesome small plates menu.

How long does it last? Usually till 1am

How many people do you expect?  We would normally get about 100 for a night like this.  Mostly 20's-40's and a good mix of men and women.

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up are only a portion of those attending from all the other different groups.  If you have a question about anything including how many to expect email [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

How many times have you walked through Grand Central and actually taken time to really appreciate how beautiful it is? With this Scavenger Hunt you will not only get to appreciate one of  New York's most iconic buildings, but you will get to meet dozens of interesting NYSN members and friends in a fun and casual way. It is even more beautiful at night!  Following the Scavenger Hunt stay at Lexington's for a fun cocktail party.

Come alone or with a friend and we will team you up with others attending.  Enjoy a cocktail  with the group then we will send you out on your adventure.

Each team will have 75 minutes to complete the scavenger hunt with a list of questions, challenges, and puzzles.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Cost: $10 PLEASE BRING EXACT CHANGE IF YOU CAN

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

What to wear: dress for the weather but 98% of the clues are inside Grand Central

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We will team you up with other fun people.

Following the hunt you will come back to Lexington's and stay at the Cocktails and Conversations Party for FREE!!!

HOW IT WORKS: Please arrive at 8pm sharp.  We will check you in and put you on teams if you don't already have one.  As soon as we get you on a team we will send you over to Grand Central for the hunt.  When you are finished looking for clues come back to Lexington's for our party and we will announce the winners.
results.name: Grand Central Scavenger Hunt and Party

results.description:
Click the link below to RSVP for this event:


http://www.bigmaven.com/experience/urbexpo-over-under-within/

The New York Adventure Club inaugural “UrbExpo” is a pop-up art exhibit documenting Urban Explorer subculture in present day New York City.

The cold, gothic features of the infamous Jefferson Market Library, accentuated with dramatic lighting and the Philip Glass soundtrack from 1983 cult classic Koyaanisqatsi, will showcase how several prominent photographers, videographers, and painters interpret their urban surroundings.

Ten artists, one 1870s courthouse, and three hours of exploration await. Young photographers in the show are balanced with established veterans in the field. Infiltrations, both legal and otherwise, spice up this display of iconic city images that will never be together again.

Take a moment to enjoy this creative break from the New York norm. Bring your flashlight, an open mind, and a few dollars if you want to take home a print ($40 for 1, $100 for 3). One night only.

Participating Artists:

Steve Duncan, videographer — undercity.org

Melanie de Groot van Embden, videographer — urbanescape.fr

Salvador Espinoza, photographer — @sespin

Mark Beckenbach, photographer — @hussshhh

Enrique Rosas, photographer — @en_ri

Judyta Grudzien, photographer — judytagrudzien.wordpress.com

Maximus Clarke, 3D photographer —MaximusClarke.com / ParallaxCity.com

Murzz, painter — @_murrz

Thompson Ukpebor, photographer — @thompsonlxs_

Corey William Schneider, photographer —nyadventureclub.com, @nyadventureclub

Curator:

Rich Garr — richgarr.com / @GothamSideWalks
results.name: UrbExpo: Over, Under, & Within

RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game.

I am not reserving 2 spots per game for any new players who have not played with us yet.

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave

results.description:
The party starts in NYC where we’ll take the subway to Brooklyn. Be assured that this is not your normal train ride. 2 channels of music bumping non-stop as your tour guide/MC teaches you about NYC. We then arise from the ground and take the party to the Brooklyn Bridge as we walk/dance/sing/and party all the way back to our final bar destination to party the rest of the night.

Get your tickets here and get them soon. The price goes WAY UP as event day draws nearer. 

Here's a video of last years' Brooklyn Bridge Quiet Clubbing Party!!!!

https://youtu.be/EghFwXZ8q6k

As always, the Date Walking Host, Beau will be there to make introductions.
results.name: Quiet Clubbing on the Brooklyn Bridge - SOLD OUT

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Lexington's Lounge at The Cort Hotel is a classy, sophisticated and upscale lounge without the attitude!  It is one of our favorite gathering spots in the city! Please join us for this special night out will get to meet other members and friends  in a comfortable and casual atmosphere.  We'll have staff on hand to welcome you and live DJ music played at conversational levels beginning at 9pm.

Here is what to expect:

-Doors open at 8pm

-Our staff will be at the check in table ready to greet you and introduce you to others at the party.

-We'll have a few fun games for you to participate in between 8:30-9:30pm that will get you up and around meeting even more people in the group.

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Live DJ plays chill out retro lounge music from 9pm-1am

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending show up on their own.

Dress code: keep it neat.  Please no sneakers or t-shirts

Is there food available?  Yes, they have an awesome small plates menu.

How long does it last? Usually till 1am

How many people do you expect?  We would normally get about 100 for a night like this.  Mostly 20's-40's and a good mix of men and women.
results.name: Saturday Night Cocktails & Conversations at Lexington's Lounge: FREE Admission!

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
Hey everyone, my comedy show "End of The Line" is back at QED this Saturday night with an awesome lineup of some of NYC's best comedians. It's always a good time and I love BSing with people from the neighborhood before and after the show. 

Featuring standup from: 

Gastor Almonte (Stoops 2 Stages Podcast) 

Chris Keise 

Nadie King (Smart Comedy) 

Spring Day 

Matt Leary 

...And more!

*Lineup subject to change

Come out at 9, grab a drink and a seat, and we'll start the show right at 9:30pm. You can't beat a show of this quality for just 6 bucks in advance at qedastoria.com or $8 day of show! I hope to see you there!!

We have a full field permit at 9:00 pm at Pier 40 through June 18, 2016. We are looking to grow and develop the sport, so we need players, and bring friends! If we can build this to a sustaining level we'll extend it into the summer and fall. Show off your skills or learn some new ones, and have a great run!!


We are planning a full field game so we need at least enough people to field two teams.  D-poles are welcome and if you know any goalies bring them along. Try to arrive 15 minutes early so we can go live at 9:00 PM!!!  See you Saturday!

We invite you to join An Exclusive Gathering of Friends and Social Circles for a truly one of a kind, all-out Desi Party like no other, celebrate in dramatic New York style and spoil yourself with modern luxury all at Lexicon.  


A Weekly Desi Party of Exclusivity, Luxury & Debauchery....Bollywood Style 

Few Pics From Our Recent Event : http://on.fb.me/1ItEDAo
Few Pics From Our Recent Event : http://on.fb.me/1LSyuIY
Few Pics From Our Recent Event : http://on.fb.me/1XNCkdh
Few Pics From Our Recent Event : http://on.fb.me/1QkcVHo

DESI SATURDAYS

Presents

BOLLYWOOD BEATS

At New York City’s Mega Nightclub & Lounge
L E X I C O N
226 East 54th Street. NYC 

Lexicon Residents : Dj Harsh & Dj Amit
Dhol Percussions By : RAVI BINDRA

Dress Code: Fashion Forward & Chic
Strictly No T-shirts, No Boots, No sneakers. 
21 & Over - Proper ID Required For Admission

For RSVP : www.DesiSaturdays.com
For VIP Table Reservations : 908 - 425 - 1603

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

Enjoy Atlantic Records Legacy Artist MORGAN PAUL and Violin Virtuoso BEN ZABEL playing Classic Rock favorites by Elton John, Billy Joel, Lionel Richie, Harry Chapin, Bob Segar, Eagles, and many more!  When listening to Morgan Paul, you will swear you are listening to the original artist singing the song.


A Morgan Paul & Friends performance is truly unique in the way they perform the most popular songs of our time.  Paul and Ben create a compelling and rich theatre-style sound,  you will think they are accompanied by a full band. 


Come out for an evening you will not forget...and be mesmerized by this duo!!

results.description:
Join us this weekend for our fun Saturday evening @ Hudson Terrace. This is a very popular party with an amazing crowd.

We will be on the first floor of the venue near the coat check area. 

Feel free to invite your family, friends and colleagues to join us at Hudson Terrace.

Gents reduced all night long- $20. Ladies free before midnight. Doorman's discretion afterwards. (Mention Rory's List to the door person)

There will be a 1 hour open bar from 10- 11pm.

Feel free to come solo. You are guaranteed to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

This event normally attracts people in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Please get there early to avoid the long lines.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

[masked]

Break Free from Fossil Fuels in Albany is coming right up, on Saturday, May 14.

RESERVE YOUR SEAT ON THE ROUND-TRIP, NYC-ALBANY BUS NOW!

TO RESERVE YOUR SEAT, GO TO THE 350NYC EVENTBRITE PAGE HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/break-free-albany-2016-bus-from-nyc-to-albany-tickets-24379323212?utm_campaign=order_confirmation_email&utm_medium=email&ref=eemailordconf&utm_source=eb_email&utm_term=eventname

Let's have a HUGE TURN-OUT from NYC -- PLEASE SHARE THIS INFORMATION WIDELY ON AND OFF-LINE.

What is Break Free Albany? Possibly the single most important global climate change resistance action in 2016.

To learn more about it, sign up to take action, and receive email updates about logistics, go here: http://www.albany2016.org/

To deepen your understanding of why oil "bomb trains" are the primary target of Break Free Albany, view this brief video:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5JbvvE3x6hY

BREAK FREE ALBANY WILL INCLUDE ACTIONS FOR THOSE WISHING TO RISK ARREST IN DIRECT ACTION, AND FOR OTHERS WISHING TO RALLY IN SUPPORT. WHATEVER YOU CHOOSE AND ARE ABLE TO DO, YOU ARE NEEDED. Break Free Albany action schedule:

Saturday, May 7: 350NYC is holding a Non-violent Direct Action Training to prepare those planning to engage in civil disobedience in Albany on May 14. The training will be from 9-12:30 pm, at NY Society for Ethical Culture, 2 W. 64th St. @ Central Park West. You need to register for the training by going to the same Eventbrite page for bus reservations above.

Wednesday, May 11-Friday, May 13: Break Free Training Camp in Albany-building action and organizing skills to take back to your community.

Friday, May 13: Break Free Flotilla, find details on Break Free Albany website link above.

Saturday, May 14: Mass Action to Stop the Bomb Trains -- non-violent civil disobedience AND support rally.

Please make Break Free Albany a priority if you can. The bigger we are, the louder our voices, the more effective we will be -- #KeepItInTheGround #BreakFree #ShutDownIndianPoint #100%RenewablesBy2030

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans, 


Formula One heads to Spain for Round 5 of the 2016 F1 World Championship. This marks the start of the European stretch on the race calendar.

Championship Standing: Nico Rosberg who is perfect thus far is leading the Drivers Championship on four wins with 100 points. His teammate Lewis Hamilton is second with 57 points, followed by Kimi Raikkonen with 43 points. On the Constructor front, Mercedes leads with 157 points, followed by Ferrari and Red Bull with 76 and 57 points respectively.

The Track: It is said that a car that does well at the Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya will do well for the rest of the season. The 4.655 km long track has 16 corners including a 1 km long main straight that represents the best shot at overtaking, with top speeds exceeding 330 kph. The track is a mix of medium to fast corners in the first and second sectors, and slow corners in the third. Having a good down force package is key but one also needs some straight line speed to overtake and good traction for the last sector. The constantly changing wind direction makes the car set up and driving all the more challenging for the teams.

DRS Zones: There will be two DRS zones. The first is on the main straight, with a detection point right after the Turn 14-15 chicane. The second is on the shorter back straight between turn 9 and 10, with detection point right before turn 9.

Tire Allocation: The fast corners, especially the long turn 3, and the abrasive asphalt make the track one of the most punishing of the entire season for the tires. The Hard (Orange), Medium (White) and Soft (Yellow) compounds will be available throughout the weekend. The most likely tire strategy will be 2 or 3 pit stops.

Talking points: Will Nico Rosberg continue his perfect season with his fifth win? Or will Lewis Hamilton finally get his first win of the year? Can Ferrari turn around their misfortune and secure a victory? Can Haas F1 once again have a strong race with a handful of points? Has McLaren Honda finally found the speed to compete with the top teams?

Race will start at 08:00 AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 07:30 AM EDT. It's going to be another exciting race. We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2016 Spanish Grand Prix

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. 

- Rmbr, it's a early morning game. Therefore, if you can't make it, change your RSVP well BEFORE Saturday 9pm to give enough notice for anyone on the waitlist. Changing your RSVP after 9pm will also mean a 2 weeks ban.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

Absolutely no exceptions to these rules.


PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

Hello Mums - join us in this fun, invigorating early morning workout with Personal Trainer - Andra Roig. Set in the beautiful Arthur Ross Pinetum (entrance at 85th & CPW)this weekly get together is just $20 and a great opportunity to meet other Mums, get your heart-rate up and have a laugh! Its early so that we can get back to our loves and get to that hearty brunch ;-)

All levels of fitness are welcomed and included - even if you haven't worked out for a while don't be put off, we've all been there. He will push you to just the right level but this is not Military Fitness so give it a try! Andra will work with each individual giving dedicated guidance and support to increase your fitness levels. He uses great equipment including battle ropes, TRX bands and kettle bells to make the work out varied and interesting. Please check out his website www.roigragefitness.com and get in touch with him prior to joining so he can add you to the weekly announcement messages.

I look forward to meeting anyone who fancies joining!

results.description:
Come join as we hike the Wilkenson Trail from Breakneck to Beacon! It's going to be a long strenuous trail.  Although we'll avoid the intense Breakneck scramble, we will journey ~10 miles through the Hudson Valley from Breakneck to Beacon before finishing off at a lovely eatery in Beacon.  We'll have beautiful views of the Hudson River along the route and of the entire Hudson Valley from the Fire Tower.

Level = Strenuous
Pets / children okay? = No
Elevation Gain = ~1,000 feet
Length = 10 miles
Time spent hiking = 6-7 hours
Train time - 1.5 hours each way
Trail type = Start at Breakneck train station, end at Beacon train station
Duration = Meet around 8am, return at 7/8pm
When = Sunday 5/15

Hope you can join! Specifics and more details to be provided once registered.

This event is restricted to 15 spots, hurry and sign up to join! :)

RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.description:
WHO: Sifu Robert

WHAT: Jeet Kune Do/Jun Fan Gung Fu & SDKT

WHERE: Regular meeting place.

WHEN: Every Sunday from 8:30am until 10:30am unless noted otherwise.

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street.
The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave. Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Driving Directions

Take Skyline Drive to its northwestern terminus at Greenwood Lake Turnpike (County Route 511). Turn right, continue for 3.4 miles, and turn left onto Stonetown Road. (For these 3.4 miles, Greenwood Lake Turnpike closely parallels the Wanaque Reservoir, and the turn onto Stonetown Road is the first left turn that you can make.) Turn right onto Lake Riconda Drive and continue to the cul-de-sac at the end of the road, where parking is available.

results.description:
For our last pedagogy meetup of the academic year, we're very excited to welcome back special guest speaker, Michael Kölling in from the UK to talk about recent developments to the Greenfoot environment. 

Join us to hear from Michael and three other presenters, who will pull from their diverse experiences to share strategies for both teaching CS and integrating it into other subject domains. 


> Michael Kölling: Greenfoot, Stride and Java: Transitioning from Blocks to Text

Greenfoot is a popular educational programming environment, which traditionally used Java as the user language. More recently, a new language named "Stride" was added to Greenfoot as an alternative. The novelty of Stride lies in its programming interaction design: Halfway between block-based languages (such as Scratch or Alice) and text-based programming, it provides a great stepping stone from one into the other. In this talk, Michael will present Greenfoot, Stride, and Java, and demonstrate how it can support the transition step into text-based programming.


Michael is Professor at the School of Computing, University of Kent.

> Kelly Powers & Andre Harris: Integrating CT Across the Curriculum: One school's journey

Teacher leaders ​at South Bronx Early College Academy ​with support of a CSNYC researcher ​have begun documenting a process to integrate CT across their middle school curriculum. The pilot subject is Physical Education, ​linking learning in ​Health & Fitness ​and Computer Science with a focus on using Data to create a Project Based Learning experience that targets learning goals mapped to CSTA Computational Thinking learning standards and National Physical Education standards. 

Teachers will learn about the process implemented to create a project based learning unit focused on integrating CS across disciplines that results in both teachers intentionally using the same language in their classrooms, while collaborating on an inquiry focused methodology of teaching. Teachers will review student project work that incorporates slides, spreadsheets, charts and video created by students​.​ ​This work​ shows evidence of the ​development of Computational Thinking ​as students ​ learn and apply CS skills​ to work with Data ​collected ​in Health and Fitness​ classes in a collaborative effort put forth by both teachers​ to create a single learning community across subject areas.​ This work by students reflects 'real world' practices, recognizing that knowledge making and the development of understanding are typically accomplished through collaborations across professional disciplines.

Kelly is Director of Computer Science Education at South Bronx Early College Academy Charter School.

Andre is Lead Physical Education / Health Teacher at South Bronx Early College Academy Charter School.

> Meredith Towne: Bridging The Gap: CS and the Content Classroom

CS is not something to be feared. With the roll out of the CS For All initiative in NYC schools, teachers can and should look for engaging ways to collaborate, integrate and create new learning experiences for themselves and their students using CS and their content. As an English and Theatre Arts teacher, Meredith found a natural connection between Scratch and Theatre Arts, specifically Directing skills. Capitalizing on the work the 9th graders do in their CS courses at AFSE, Meredith created an interdisciplinary unit- Partner Scenes, Directing and Scratch. This presentation will cover the development process, final unit and materials, and student work samples.


Meredith is a teacher at the Academy for Software Engineering (AFSE).

> Tanner Welsh: Test-driven Creativity

In the world of professional software development, test-driven development (TDD) is a popular methodology for writing code using short development cycles with frequent feedback. The core procedure of TDD is simple: write a failing test, write code to make it pass, and then improve your code. In this workshop, participants will learn about TDD and explore both simple and creative ways that it can be applied in a classroom environment. The possible applications are many: as an assessment tool, as a means of encouraging good problem-solving habits, and as a language for expressing clear outcomes. All participants will have the opportunity to both solve and write tests during this workshop. 

Tanner is an educator at the Learners Guild.

REGISTRATION STARTS AT 9:00AM

What is JoomlaCamp?

It is an unstructured conference where mentors will run workshops along with the participants.  We will determine the workshops at the first start of the day, all participants will be asked, 'what do you want to learn'??  Once we put a list together, we will assign mentors to the different topics and run with it!

What about newbies?

Laura Gordon will lead a 2 hour Intro to Joomla 'class', and go over the basics of Joomla with the group that needs it.  During each session we will be able to help out the 'newbies' with patience and learning!  We highly recommend that if you are a newbie, to purchase the book from Steve Burge, joomlaExplained...a great resource to have on your desk!

What do I bring?

A laptop or tablet would be helpful so you can work along with the mentors for each of the workshops.  If you have a specific site you are working on, it is helpful if you know how to login.  We will have notepads and pens for you to jot down helpful hints!

Can we 'troubleshoot site issues'?

Possibly, the goal is to work with everyone in small groups, so 1 on 1 consulting is difficult to do at this type of event.  But, you will get the names of our mentors, and can contact them after the event, and discuss their rates, etc.

Lightening Round?

We will have a lightening round at the end of the day.  what is it?  Questions can be asked of the mentors, and the mentors will have a maximum of 2 minutes to answer the question.  This happens quickly, but sometimes many small questions get answered, and answered well!

Discounts offered!

Many component developers are offering us AMAZING discounts for ATTENDEES of JOOMLACAMP ONLY!!!  So come!

1. Siteground is donating discounted hosting for all attendees - with 3 months FREE of  Siteground Hosting
2. Ideal Extensions is giving us 10 coupon codes for 50% off their products!  All profits made from these purchase will be sent directly to JoomlaUsersNJ!
I can give you 10 coupons of 50% off coupons:4 for Contact Enhanced PRO (U$49)3 for iFAQ PRO (U$25)3 for Ideal Related Articles (U$18)
All profit from these sales will go back to the joomlausersnj.com
3. All attendees will receive 20% off Mobile Joomla products!
4. All attendees will receive 33% off at OSTraining.com
5. All attendees will receive 50% off at Simplify your Web
6. All attendees will receive 50% off RSForms and RS Firewall!

Join us for this beautiful spring day out of the city as we enjoy the amazing sights of the Shawangunk Mountains along Lake Minewaska Path, an easy hike at The Minnewaska Preserve. This is a great start of season hike as well as a good hike for beginners. You day will begin with the beautiful ride up the Hudson River Train line on Metro North.  Your guide will pick you up in Poughkeepsie, NY to start you adventure!  We'll pick up a snack and head over to Lake for lunch and an easy hike (1 hour 30 minutes).  Along the way you will be treated to waterfalls, beautiful rock formations and breathtaking views. From there we'll head to a local winery for samples of some great local wines.


<a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hudson-valley-spring-walkhike-at-lake-minnewaskaawosting-falls-winery-tickets-24911241193"></a>

Hike level: 4 out of 10. There are 3 different inclines that would be the same stress level as climbing 8 flights of stairs.  We do not rush.

You will be back on the 5:54 train to NYC.

Can I come alone? Yes, most of the people attending come on their own. Our staff is great at introducing you to others at the event and keeping the conversations lively!

What to expect: 10-14 participants

What to wear: hiking shoes or sturdy sneakers

What to bring: lunch, bottled water

What is included? transportation to and from Poughkeepsie train to all attractions,  hiking fees, taxes and tips.

Not Included: Train fare (you may also drive to Poughkeepsie),  lunch, winery fees

Admission: $55 

What if it rains?  Refunds are only given if the trip is canceled due to rain.

This is a repeat of a ride a few weeks ago when the weather was really cold and only a couple intrepid riders went for it!   Once again this is for stronger riders who don't have a problem maintaining a pace of about 20mph, although we won't be trying to set any speed records either!  A great ride to know if you want to head up into Connecticut. We can also add in another pickup point for anyone who happens to be between Prospect Park and the Bronx, just let m know in the comments.

The total ride is about 75 miles and we will make two stops on the way up to Fairfield CT.  If someone has to bail early there are train stations all along this route.

 First stop will be about 25 miles into the ride at a fabulous little espresso and pastry shop we found on the last trip.  After that we'll go for about another 25 miles and then lay up at a little cove that has beautiful views of the Rowayton harbor.  Last 25 miles will take us up to Fairfield.  For anybody interested there are a few choices for food and drink up in fairfield including a basic beer and burger joint, a great Mexican place and also a very good asian fusion restaurant which are all reasonable.

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
Exploring the end of Henry Hudson northern section at Sandy Hook Bay. This paved, 10-foot wide, 24-mile long trail is a former railroad right-of-way.  It is relatively flat, traveling through both man-made and natural environments.  Much of the trail is tree-lined, though some parts have views of surrounding wetlands, streams and fields. 

Trail conditions are primitive and users should expect wet and muddy patches, with no alternate route around. Additionally, some trail neighbors have been granted permission to use the trail for construction vehicle access as they continue to make repairs to their storm damaged properties. Users should exercise caution and watch for construction vehicles in some locations. 


Parking Lot: 369 Shore Dr. Highlands, NJ 07732 or [masked], [masked]

https://www.google.com/maps/place/40%C2%B024'34.5%22N+74%C2%B000'10.5%22W/@40.409579,-74.0051167,603m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x0!8m2!3d40.409579!4d-74.002928


More park info: https://www.monmouthcountyparks.com/page.aspx?ID=2525

Trail Map: http://co.monmouth.nj.us/documents/130/hht_north_may_13.pdf

We will walk for about 4 miles. We can stop at my favorite pastry shop, The Flaky Tart, at Atlantic Highlands.

results.description:
Coming up on the weekend of May 14 and 15 at Pier 92 in NYC, the New YORK BABY SHOW, presented by New York Family Magazine, is geared for new and expectant parents as well as those with toddlers from the New York Tri-State area.  


The NYC Dads Group, the flagship outpost of City Dads Group, is a community of dads that believe that fathers can be nurturing and capable caregivers. We also know that when a dad is engaged through pregnancy, birth, and the first weeks of his child's lives, he sets the foundation for a life as an active and involved parenting partner. With this in mind, we are thrilled to once again host the #DadsLounge at the New YORK BABY SHOW on May 16 and 17 at Pier 92 in New York City.

The DADS LOUNGE sponsored by BabyNes will be an upscale, warm, and inviting destination with carpeting, changing tables, couches, and glider chairs. We'll also be inviting many of our favorite dad bloggers, journalists, authors, and other parenting experts to join us in the lounge to talk about all things fatherhood and parenting. This is the perfect opportunity to grow our group, meet thousands of new & expectant dads, and share our experiences/best practices.

We hope to recruit lots of our nyc dads group members to volunteer and help us out in the dads lounge over the course of the weekend. If you're interested to volunteer and help us...please RSVP and we'll follow up to schedule a 2- 4 hour time slot.

We want to have a huge presence with many of our nyc dads group members especially our most active members.  This year, it's the mission of New York Family Magazine to "make the New York Baby Show the most dad-friendly baby show in all of the land." We'd like to help them deliver on that promise. Your role would be simple- spending time in the dads lounge sharing your unique perspective on fatherhood with dads on hand, socializing, and distributing flyers as well as walking around and enjoying the entire show.  

All volunteers will receive a code for free admission to the show, an NYC Dads Group T-shirt, and a pizza lunch.

results.description:
Come along for a scenic spring ride up the South County Trailway to the Croton Reservoir. Moderate 7-10 mph pace, 1,500 feet total elevation gain. The route has been researched for maximum beauty, with lake and river views. We will finish up at the Croton train station for the trip back to NYC. There is the option of extending the ride to Tarrytown or other points south, and there is also an option of a craft beer (or other beverage) break at the end of the ride, depending on what the group feels like doing.

Hybrid bikes would be best, but other types are also acceptable. Some sections might be hard on narrow road bike tires - most of the ride will be on asphalt, but some sections are unpaved, with ruts and roots, etc. You could pick up some lunch along the way or bring your own. Please make sure your bike is in good working condition, since I am not a mechanic and would probably not be able to fix it. Please bring plenty of water, lights for your vehicle, a spare inner tube, and a MetroNorth bicycle pass. The meetup will be near the last stop (242nd Street) on the #1 subway. Be prepared for a full day of riding. Bad weather cancels. Feel free to contact the leader with any questions. Registration required by midnight Saturday ([masked]).

results.description:
Led by Joe Kremer

Register ($15): https://personalizedfeedbackusingtechnology.eventbrite.com

Come learn a powerful method to provide your students with personalized and useful feedback. Giving personalized feedback can be challenging and enormously time-consuming, especially when teaching large numbers of students, but setting clear learning targets and using technology can make this process more efficient and effective.In this BYO-laptop workshop, we will work with spreadsheets, Python code, and YouTube to practice strategies for giving students useful, personalized feedback without spending an entire weekend grading. When assessing clear standards for assignments, spreadsheet data can be easily translated into personalized paragraphs of feedback for students by using a simple Python script. This feedback can then direct students to online videos that support their learning, or translated into a letter grade in a traditional gradebook. All tech-levels are welcome, but participants must bring a personal laptop. If you haven’t tried coding in Python, follow this link to get suggestions on where to start:https://wiki.python.org/moin/BeginnersGuide

results.description:
Wudang Wushu is a style of Chinese Martial arts. It is not very famous in the West, but in China the Taoist Wudang Mountains count as one of the three main centers of martial arts, and to some even the motherland of Tai Chi Chuan. 

The goal of the Wudang Wushu class is to teach basic martial arts coordination and develop a foundation for fighting. It consists of multi-functional physical development and strengthening the musculo-skeletal system.

You can expect an interval training, stretching, resistance training, jumps, joint mobility training (mostly hips and shoulders), kung fu stances and kicks. 

Read more about classes here.

Read more about Daria here.

Read more about Kung Fu here.

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR SOME AWESOME SINGLETRACK MOUNTAIN BIKING AT "909" (Taconic-Hereford Multiple Use Area).

Please arrive by 10:30am at the Tyrrel Road Parking Area to allow time to prep your bike and gear so that we may depart promptly by 10:45am.

Taconic Hereford MUA is affectionately known as "909" by the locals for the number of acres in the park. The terrain consists mostly of rolling hills with moderately steep slopes interspersed throughout.

Almost 4 miles of hard-packed dirt roads circle through dense hardwood forests over hilly terrain. Branching off these dirt roads are more challenging single-track loops and connectors that provide a variety of trail experiences from fast and smooth to technical, with roots, grass and loose rocks.

Depending on your mood, you can ride from 3 miles to 20 miles. To minimize riding double track, it's easy to link consecutive single track trails together. Usually the start of the next trail is right across the road from the one you're finishing.

Distance: approximately 15 miles


Estimated Bike Time: 3-4 hours

Difficulty: Intermediate - rolling hills with moderately steep slopes interspersed throughout. Rocky terrain with some logs to cross over.


Current Weather Forecast: Partly Sunny with a high of 55 degrees


MANDATORY GEAR:

• Mountain Bike

• Bicycle Helmet

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, Bug Spray, Sunscreen, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.

WHERE TO MEET?

Parking area on Tyrrel Rd, Pleasant Valley, NY

DIRECTIONS:

From the north: Take the Taconic State Pkwy south to Pleasant Valley. 909 is found at the end of Tyrell Rd., a left off of the Taconic. Parking is at the end of the road.
From the south: Take the Taconic State Pkwy north to Pleasant Valley. Turn right onto Tyrell Rd. Parking is at the end of the road.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE DESCRIPTION OF THIS EVENT CAREFULLY. I TAKE THE RSVP PROCESS SERIOUSLY AND I EXPECT THAT YOU SHOULD TOO.

Meeting details will be provided by e-mail Friday night before the event to all who RSVP.

Join me and AMC Club members who do not have to RSVP, UNLESS you do not get last minute e-mails from Yahoo on a fun but fast paced 5 mile hiking tour as we explore Vinegar Hill, Dumbo, Brooklyn Bridge Park and then make our way over Brooklyn Bridge to the newly opened part of Calatrava’s Oculus at the World Trade Center Transit Hub which is an event onto itself. There are always surprises along the way. On a number of occasions, we will stop very briefly to talk about what we see. There should be great views and many interesting things to see.

WE WILL BEGIN BEFORE 10:30 A.M. BE READY TO GO.

NO FOOD STOPS. EAT BEFORE WE MEET.

Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup.

 Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC Club members, there is NO need for AMC club members to RSVP for this-unless you don’t get last minute e-mails from Yahoo. (Contact me if you are a dues paying AMC Club member and don’t get these e-mails and I’ll tell you how). Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate. If you have been a NO SHOW on any previous AMC Meetup events that I have led or are a chronic abuser of the RSVP process –see your Attendance History- please do not sign up for this event because I am just going to delete your RSVP. Let someone else go who will actually show up. Some priority will be given to those who have previously attended other AMC Meetup events that I have led. 

I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You have more than enough information to do this once you get the meeting details. No offense, but I don’t need to know-and probably neither does anyone else- what you are doing that day if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather forecast is really bad, See the Accuweather website like I do, I will post a notice on the day of the hike by 7:00 A.M. If there is no notice, we go. We will probably finish between 1:30 -2:00 p.m. or so in Lower Manhattan.
results.name: Brooklyn Expedition–Over the Bridge, Vinegar Hill, DUMBO, Brooklyn Bridge Park

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed! 

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
Join us and the Rockaway Waterfront Alliance for a community stewardship clean up followed by a walking tour of the historical beachside bungalows.  

We will meet at Beach 25th St and the beach boardwalk at 11AM, where we will do a shoreline clean up. At 12:30 we will depart for a neighborhood walk to meet local neighbors and explore one of the last bungalow communities still in existence in New York City. 

Need transportation? RideSwell has you covered. RideSwell is a new mobile carpooling app for iOS that helps outdoor sport lovers connect to rides - then disconnect outside.  


They are excited to partner with us to help foster more ocean and coastline stewardship, making it both easy and fun - to ride together, to surf, to rally, and to organize.  

Signup now at www.rideswell.com for access to our closed BETA.
