results.description:
Join New York’s most innovative and pioneering minds as they explore the past, present, and future of immersive performance in a lively discussion format that brings innovative thoughts and concepts to life!

With a focus on implementation that is suited for all transmedia applications, moderator Jeff Wirth (Interactive PlayLab) will be joined by an elite panel of creators, including:

Victor Carinha


Journey Lab, www.journeylab.org
Victor Carinha is the Founder and Artistic Director of Journey Lab, a media brand focused on rediscovering how audiences experience storytelling. As a New York actor and theatre artist, he blends his penchant for connection, travel, and art to co-create ambitious and intimate productions behind an accessible brand.

Carlo D’Amore

Live In Theater, www.liveintheater.com
Carlo is an award winning actor, playwright and Drama Desk nominated director, as well as the creative force behind Live In Theater. Since 2009 LIT has re­imagined the murder mystery genre. By blending award ­winning acting, real historical murders, city streets, and a heightened sense of realism, audiences experience high-caliber,­ in-­your-­face, cutting-edge theater.

Erin Mee
This Is Not A Theatre Company, www.erinbmee.com
Erin B Mee is the Artistic Director of This Is Not A Theatre Company and director of Pool Play, A Serious Banquet, Readymade Cabaret, Ferry Play, Versailles 2016, Where Have All The Glaciers Gone?, Un Café, and This Is Not a Subway Ride. She is the author of several books, and is Assistant Arts Professor of Drama at Tisch, NYU.

Peter Musante
petermusante.com
Peter Musante works at the nexus of immersive theater, dance, music and technology to invent unique performance-based experiences that transform space and create community. His original works are devised collaboratively, tour internationally and have been presented by such NYC institutions as Lincoln Center, Park Avenue Armory and The Brooklyn Navy Yard.

Andrew Hoepfner 
Houseworld, http://houseworld.nyc/index.php
Andrew Hoepfner is a playwright and musician based in Ridgewood, Queens. He is the creator of the immersive experience, Houseworld, in which guests step into an old mansion, one by one, and enter a dreamworld. Hoepfner has collaborated on previous works with Young Jean Lee, Cesar Alvarez, and David Byrne.

Annie Arthur Kaup
Annie's Shakespeare Shakedown, www.AnnieAction.com
Annie Arthur Kaup created Annie's Shakespeare Shakedown, an interactive, immersive experience of staged scenes that evolve in real time with improvisation.  The audience is drawn into the world of the play, asked for advice, and encouraged to fulfill an integral role of the play. Each performance is a living experiment where the cast and audience merge.


aLyssa Kim
Rocking Dead: Bedlam, http://www.feast-productions.com/rocking-dead-bedlam/
aLyssa Kim is a performer/writer/director/producer/choreographer. Co-conceived, wrote, and directed the completely immersive and interactive show, Rocking Dead: Bedlam. A member of a NYC-based interactive company for 5 years, she created and conceived many productions with them. Produces and directs music videos, dance concept videos and short films.

Lauren Rayner
Lauren Rayner Productions, www.laurenrayner.com
Lauren Rayner is an independent freelance producer and has masterminded over 75 stage, film and multi-media projects since 2005. Favorite immersive performance producing credits include Take Me Home, the show in a taxi (Ontological, 3LD); A Food Odyssey (Invisible Dog); and Please Do [Not] Disturb (LMCC, Sightline).

Jeff Wirth - Moderator
Interactive PlayLab, www.interactiveplaylab.com
Jeff Wirth directs the Interactive PlayLab, with a mission of training, research and development, and prototyping of applied interactive performance. He wrote the book Interactive Acting, and has written and directed over 100 interactive performance experiences. Jeff has consulted for Blue Man Group, Disney Imagineering, and Cirque du Soleil.
results.name: Crash Course in Interactive and Immersive Performance

results.description:
6/15 GREEN HOLDS ANNUAL SPRING PLANT SALE


6/15 Green, a community garden located at 6th Avenue and 15th Street in Park Slope, will hold the final day of its Spring Plant Sale on Sunday, May 15, from 11am - 3pm . Heirloom and regular vegetable plants, flowers and divisions of unique plants from the garden will be available for garden beds, planters and pots.

Plants will also be available for sale when the garden gates are open on weekdays May 9 through May 19.

All sales help cover the expenses of maintaining the garden as a vibrant urban greenspace.

6/15 Green will also host its annual Spring Festival on Saturday, May 14 from 11-5. If the Festival is rained out on May 14th, it will take place on Sunday, May 15 from 11am-5pm.

These events help the garden fulfill its mission to provide cultural and educational activities in this welcoming community space. The public, neighbors and friends are encouraged to visit this permanent neighborhood garden and enjoy an oasis in the midst of the City’s hubbub. 6/15 Green is a 501 ( c ) 3 organization, and contributions are tax-deductible. Donations are welcome! visit www.615green.org

6/15 Green is a proud member of the Brooklyn Alliance of Neighborhood Gardens Land Trust (BANG)

Nearby transportation: F train to 9th St. or to 15th St; B63 bus along 5th Ave or B67 & B69 along 7th Ave.
results.name: FREE: 6/15 GREEN HOLDS ANNUAL SPRING PLANT SALE

results.description:
Please Note: This event is taking place at the New York Society for Ethical Culture (at 64th Street and Central Park West in Manhattan). You are encouraged to join us there! 

We will try to have a video stream of the event showing at the Society for Ethical Culture in Riverdale (at 4450 Fieldston Road) but it will not be interactive. Although you can come to the Society at 11 am for that viewing, we encourage you to join us at the New York Society for this exciting anniversary event!


Fifty years after giving his founding address of Ethical Culture, Felix Adler reflected upon that day: “. . .the people [interested in starting an Ethical movement] asked with intense feeling, what consecrating influence shall we bring into our own lives, and particularly into the lives of our children? – indeed it was a concern for the children even more than for themselves that led to the formation of these societies.”

Today we reflect on the history of people who intentionally centered their lives around the study and practice of ethics, who built a community that placed “Deed Above Creed,” and who continue to inspire us. We also commit ourselves to future generations by promoting a reverence for life and finding relevance for ethical values. We will be joined by members of other Ethical Societies in a morning of music, words and movement.
results.how_to_find_us: Visit www.rysec.org/directions
results.name: Founder’s Day: Celebrating 140 Years of Ethical Living

results.description:
With Spring in the Air

We love hiking, so why not Hike to a True Adventure..

Aa "Ghost Town" an Historical Abandoned Area...

There is a place, a very dark place. It might be the scariest place you have ever been to in your life.
I was reminded of traveling to this place by my friends.
There are tunnels located at the top of Clausland Mountain in Orangeburg. 

My friend took me there about four years ago and he will guide us up there again.
He said the tunnels were originally built as an army base during WWI in case of invasion. They were also used for drills and training. There are miles of tunnels throughout the mountain. Visible concrete walls run through the woods. Each tunnel also has another tunnel under it. There are many secret caverns and rooms throughout the passageways. There are also bomb shelter rooms and rooms under rooms called hell holes.

My friend also told me of a other stories that he will share that day. He is a Police officer for the State Police and he will be our Guide on this Adventure.

So sprawled over 321 acres of Blauvelt State Park on the slopes of Clausland Mountain lies the ruins of a pre-World War One rifle range known as Camp Bluefields. Now totally abandoned, these "army tunnels" and the surrounding area were once a buzzing hive of activity eighty years ago.


In 1910 the New York National Guard built the range to replace Creedmoor, its old range on Long Island. However, the marksmen imported from Long Island and other parts of the Metropolitan area were not happy with the range. They claimed that the layout of the range necessitated shooting with the sun in one's eyes, and that Blauvelt was simply too inaccessible. (After all, twenty-two miles was quite a ride in those days). Soon after the range was opened it became evident that the weekend warriors were not the only ones who had gripes about Camp Bluefields. Irate citizens of South Nyack found that their southern neighbors were spewing a hail of lead upon them. Bullets for this range (built on high ground as it was) often overshot their targets, raining down upon the unhappy citizenry and causing quite a furor. By June of 1912, sufficient numbers of houses had been pierced by the errant missiles to cause the Guard to cease operation.

The embarrassed New York Guard gave this tract of land to the Palisades Interstate Park Commission, after only three years of use... This white elephant was last used during World War Two, when soldiers from nearby Camp Shanks used it for training. Since then, Camp Bluefields has been left alone to the dual ravages of time and the elements. Rumors about the range being cursed and haunted have abounded, which is not surprising considering its isolated location and state of disrepair.


Many times he has seen much satanic evidence such as fire rings. Most people say the whole place is haunted. 

On the brighter side, its a facination place, if you visit the tunnels, there is much great graffiti from crews like NVSP, and ABK. Other local writers such as Domain and Rook also have pieces of art there.

45 min Ride each way-


Shuttle Bus will  take us there and back

(Round Trip Transportation Tour Guide for) 

For $23.00 pp 

Its an easy walk, 3.5 miles Round trip w Minimal Elevations Changes 

We need a guide because maps are not accurate w GPS

You should bring Water, Camera,  cells phones, Comforting walking shoes and flashlights- 

Questions? [masked]


Thanks, Robert

results.description:
Silence is Golden

This Improve with Improv Workshop will focus on nonverbal communication. Many actors feel uncomfortable when they are not talking. There is often a rush to find things to do when there is silence. This can become frantic and take away from the truthfulness of the scene.

In this workshop you will engage in exercises and scenework that restrict or limits verbal communication which encourages the performer to discover other ways of communicating.


A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.


Suggested Donation: $15 (or whatever you can pay)*

*free drink with $15 donation

*most improv classes in NYC cost approximately $35-$50 per session

_____________________________________________________________________

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.

Details Below:

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed! 

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Paul.

The 18th-century historian Edward Gibbon opined that the rule of the Nerva Antonine emperors was a time when "the Roman Empire was governed by absolute power, under the guidance of wisdom and virtue".

Nerva was the first of the dynasty. Though his reign was short, it saw a partial reconciliation between the army, Senate and commoners. Nerva adopted as his son the popular military leader Trajan. Hadrian succeeded Trajan.

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.

results.description:
Updated March 5, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Come join us for Hudson River Park Community Fest!


Experience outrigger paddling for free.

This event is open to the public on a first come, first served basis.

RSVPing to this meeup does not guarantee you a spot.

However, your acknowledgement helps us plan our day to make sure we get you on the water as quickly as possible!

A completed waiver is required for participation.

Click here to fill out the waiver.

We paddle rain or shine except when there is lightening.  Remember to wear sunscreen and to bring a bottle of water in the canoe to stay hydrated. You are free to wear whatever you want provided you do not mind the possibility of it getting wet. You may want to consider bringing something dry you can change into afterwards. Assume anything you bring in the canoe will get soaked and/or lost.

The novice sessions will involve a half hour introduction on the dock to familiarize you with the technique, commands and safety protocol of the canoe. This is then followed by a 30 to 45 minute session on the water.

More details can be found at: http://newyorkoutrigger.org/novices/program-description/

DONATIONS:

One final note, you may already know that we are a non-profit 501c3 educational organization and fully volunteer based. Any cash or check donations – while not required - would be greatly appreciated and go towards funding our efforts  to continue providing New Yorkers with the experience of outrigger paddling in New York City.

Any donations can be given your land training instructor.  In addition, you can donate via our website

http://newyorkoutrigger.org/members/

by clicking on the "Donate" button.

Fasting can help to wipe the slate clean of addictive food cravings, overeating, and fatigue. Get back on your healthy eating! This juice fasting group will include the option to consume raw blended soups. Some of you have expressed interest in conducting a juice fast, but feel it to be a little too extreme or feel intimidated by taking on such an endeavor. We will cover all the details to conduct a juice fast, as well as a blended nutritional cleanse. This is a great way to experience a cleanse in a modified way. 


The next Juice Fasting Group will meet on


Sunday, MAY 15, 2016 at 12:30 pm to 2:30 pm

Integral Yoga Institute NYC   227 West 13 Street


between 7-8 Avenue


New York, NY 10011

Every attendee will receive a package of handout information


including recipes.

http://www.gravityeastvillage.com

We will discuss all aspects to fasting including:


how to conduct a fast successfully,
why fast?,
what to expect when you are fasting,
an understanding of how the body cleanses through fasting,

results.description:
Just wanted to share this Persian Epic with the group. I'm super excited to see this.

Feathers of Fire Shadow Play
SUNDAY / MAY 15 3:00–4:30 P.M.

Delight in Feathers of Fire, a cinematic shadow-play adaptation of a tale from the Shahnama by artist Hamid Rahmanian. It tells the tale of Zal and Rudaba, two star-crossed lovers of old Persia. Zal is raised by a mythical bird in the wild. His deep love for Rudaba enables them both to triumph over inconceivable odds, and then give birth to a beloved son, Rustam—the most important mythological hero of Shahnama. Directed by Hamid Rahmanian, in collaboration with Larry Reed. Original music by Loga Ramin Torkian and Azam Ali. (70 minutes, in English).

http://www.metmuseum.org/events/programs/met-speaks/sunday-at-the-met/court-and-cosmos-part-2?eid=A001_%7b7F14D590-6993-46BE-AB31-83DD3D986EB3%7d_20151214164109&relExhi=74efafb7-a808-4ede-bf58-279e018c9f63&program=all&location=main%7cbreuer%7ccloisters&startDate=5%2f12%2f2016+12%3a22%3a22+PM&page=1


I'm planning to attend this lecture then head to the play.

Court and Cosmos, Part 1: Astronomy and Science in the Great Age of the Seljuqs Dynasty

SUNDAY / MAY 15
1:00–2:30 P.M.
Learn about the development and evolution of Islamic scientific instruments during the Seljuqs dynasty.

Speakers are Silke Ackermann, Director, Museum of the History of Science, University of Oxford; Sheila Canby, Patti Cadby Birch Curator in Charge, Department of Islamic Art, The Met; Peter J. Lu, Research Associate in Applied Physics, John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, Harvard University.

http://www.metmuseum.org/events/programs/met-speaks/sunday-at-the-met/court-and-cosmos-part-1?eid=A001_%7bE2B5318B-8544-4641-A2D0-56FC10A922BF%7d_20151214163004&relExhi=74efafb7-a808-4ede-bf58-279e018c9f63&program=all&location=main%7cbreuer%7ccloisters&startDate=5%2f12%2f2016+12%3a16%3a32+PM&page=1

results.description:
Come join us for Hudson River Park Community Fest!

Experience outrigger paddling for free.

This event is open to the public on a first come, first served basis.

RSVPing to this meeup does not guarantee you a spot.

However, your acknowledgement helps us plan our day to make sure we get you on the water as quickly as possible!

A completed waiver is required for participation.

Click here to fill out the waiver.

We paddle rain or shine except when there is lightening.  Remember to wear sunscreen and to bring a bottle of water in the canoe to stay hydrated. You are free to wear whatever you want provided you do not mind the possibility of it getting wet. You may want to consider bringing something dry you can change into afterwards. Assume anything you bring in the canoe will get soaked and/or lost.

The novice sessions will involve a half hour introduction on the dock to familiarize you with the technique, commands and safety protocol of the canoe. This is then followed by a 30 to 45 minute session on the water.

More details can be found at: http://newyorkoutrigger.org/novices/program-description/

DONATIONS:

One final note, you may already know that we are a non-profit 501c3 educational organization and fully volunteer based. Any cash or check donations – while not required - would be greatly appreciated and go towards funding our efforts  to continue providing New Yorkers with the experience of outrigger paddling in New York City.

Any donations can be given your land training instructor.  In addition, you can donate via our website

http://newyorkoutrigger.org/members/

by clicking on the "Donate" button.
results.name: Hudson River Park Community Fest - Free Outrigger Canoe Lessons at Pier 66 - 4

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is FREE for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
**Link**

http://www.nc350.org/founders-weekend-festival/


**Note**

I will be showing up around 5:00 p.m. for India's performance.  I'm ready to get my salsa on!!!

**Details**

1:00pm: Sarah Vaughan Tribute

2:30pm: Rob Paparozzi

4:00pm: Jubilation Choir with Cissy Houston

5:30pm: India

7:00pm: Power 105.1’s DJ Reymo

India

Closing out the weekend’s power lineup on Sunday will be the incomparable, India, one of the world’s top Latin music recording artists. Crowned the “Princess of Salsa” by Celia Cruz, her duet on the hit song “La Voz de la Experiencia” (The Voice of Experience) with the late Queen of Salsa unleashed a string of numerous Latin chart topping hit singles including the Grammy nominated “Sobre el Fuego” (Over the Fire), “Sola” and her first number-one song “”Sedúceme.” The romantic salsa hit brought on a greater fan base and many awards and nominations, including two Latin Grammy nominations for Best Salsa Album and Best Tropical Song in 2003, and her third Grammy Award nomination for Best Salsa Album. India has been honored with a star on the Walk of Fame at Union City’s Celia Cruz Park.

Plus, enjoy multi-attractions of activities and events throughout the park that will truly highlight the best of Newark’s arts and entertainment, culture and community.

Festival Rules


NC 350 wants everyone to have a great and safe time, so keep in mind:

No coolers No glass alcohol

No chairs or picnic blankets on the inner oval lawn in front of the mainstage; they are permitted in the outer oval (outside of the path)

No smoking in the park

No bicycles

No dogs

Bags and backpacks are subject to search

results.description:
3DPrinterOS and Ultimaker will be sponsoring our next live class on the basics of 3D printing and how it's being used today at Brooklyn Desks located at 49 Wyckoff Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11237.

This free meetup is ideally suited for someone who is brand new to 3D Printing, or someone more advanced who wants to have the chance to ask one on one questions about how the hardware, software and entire process works. All ages are welcome and encouraged to attend! 

The following topics will be covered at this meetup:

-What is 3D Printing and how does it work?

-How do we take an idea and turn it into a physical object?

One on one training and an open Q & A session on 3D Printing will also be provided. No materials or prior knowledge if necessary for this class. 

In addition, we have set the RSVP limit at 60 for this class as we have gone over capacity in the past. If you reach this limit please add yourself to the waiting list as people sometimes cancel at the last minute. Please feel free to reach out to us directly if you have any questions and we will be more that happy to oblige.

Happy printing!

results.description:
First Degree

May 15, 2016  Witch, Witch is Witch

o   The Celtic Tradition


o   Faery Wicca

o   Gardenarian Wicca

o   Alexandrian Wicca

o   Dianic Wicca

o   Cabot Tradition

o   WFT Tradition

Eclectic Witch

Minoan Sisterhood/Brotherhood Wicca

$30 in person/$33 via paypal - PLEASE bring your receipt to class.


Academy of Pagan Studies offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Starlight Vision Series and much more, such as tarot, pendulum use, candle craft, magickal herbs, spell craft, runes etc.

What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.

Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, and now our newly formed private FB group just for our students to converse, further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment.

The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!

We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy*. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.

We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished so far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Circle and do hope that after reading you will decide to join us as a Academy Student and member of The NYC Wiccan Family Temple.

We strive to provide a comprehensive selection of training programs and as such offers many other Elective Craft courses and training opportunities for seekers of knowledge and magickal expertise. We encourage you to visit our CURRICULUM PAGE & CRAFT CLASSES PAGE for a complete list of current and future programs.

We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

WE ARE THE MOST COMPREHENSIVELY TAUGHT WITCHCRAFT ACADEMY WITHIN THE NEW YORK CITY AREA.

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO FIND OUT FURTHER INFORMATION REGARDING THESE CLASSES, PLEASE GO TO www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org YOU WILL FIND REGISTRATION INFORMATION, PRICES AND OUR FULL CURRICULLUM. YOU CAN JOIN IN THESE CLASSES AT ANY TIME, AND CATCH UP WITH THE CLASSES YOU MISSED NEXT TIME IT COMES AROUND.

IF YOU HAVE NOT DONE SO, PLEASE DO BRING YOUR APPLICATION FILLED OUT WITH YOU WHEN YOU COME TO CLASS. ALSO, BRING A NOTE BOOK AND PEN OR PENCIL.

There is a one time fee per year of $25.00 registration fee.

If you pay online please bring a receipt of payment as we do not always have time to check paypal the day of the class, or we will expect you pay at the class or gathering.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT: 
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org 
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com 
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com 
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
Lengua learners! Join us for an afternoon of Spanish/English conversation exchange at Órale Mexican Kitchen.

This will be an informal gathering and food will be served. Please be considerate with your RSVP as we will need to provide the restaurant with a head count.

We will be practicing our translation, writing and pronunciation skills so please prepare a short monologue of 5 minutes or less. It can be anything from an original story to a scene in a movie or favorite book. We will break up into small groups where each person can read aloud and get feedback from other members.


For those without a story or monologue to share, join us anyway for some friendly conversation and food!

Órale Mexican Kitchen

341 Grove Street

Jersey City, NJ 07302

Menu

http://www.oralemk.com/menus/

---

¡Compañeros! Estas invitado a un intercambio de conversaciones y traducciones en Español/Ingles. Reunimos en Órale Mexican Kitchen.

Eso es un reunión informal con comida y cervezas. Por favor, considera tu RSVP porque necesitamos dar la restaurante una cuenta preciso de personas quien quieren compartir.

Esta ves, practicaremos traducción, escribiendo y pronunciación. Por favor trae un monologo corto, casi cinco minutos o menos. Podría ser cualquier cosa. Un historia original, una escena de una película o por tu libro favorito. Vamos a Separar en grupos pequeños y leeer lo que preparemos en voz alta. Los otros en el grupo pueden darte consejos y ayuda.

Para las personas no tienen un historia o monologo, acompáñenos de todos modos por conversación simpático y comida muy rica!

This is a great event where you can experience some of the Endangered Wildlife that calls the Bronx Zoo home. At the same time, meet some fun singles, make some new friends and maybe more at this great informal event.

http://assets.worldwildlife.org/photos/2330/images/hero_small/polar-bear-hero.jpg?1345901694

How it works/ Itinerary 
The tour starts at 1:30 PM SHARP (arrive by 1:00 PM), (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the Zoo.

We will be doing the Endangered Wildlife tour which will explore the causes as to why wildlife is disappearing learning what conservation actions people can take to prevent it. Animals we will visit may include but are not limited to:

Western Lowland Gorillas

Snow Leopards

Polar Bears

White Rhino

Malayan Tapir

Black Leopard

Amur Tiger

Note: This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. Please attend if you have an interest in the museum and are looking to meet other fun singles.


Meeting Locations

Option 1) We will meet at Penn Station and take the train together. It lets us off just a few blocks from the Zoo

Option 2) Meet at the Zoo

NOTE: You must arrive by 1 PM.. Tour starts at 1:30. If you arrive after we leave you will have no way to find the group.

The Tour goes for two hours and is rain or shine. They have indoor exhibits if it rains.. $39.75- $49.75 depending on when you register


- BUY TICKETS HERE

results.description:
Today is your last chance to Qualify for the following:

On May 20th we've organized FPV races and a Final to be held on Pier A in Hoboken at the 2016 annual Propeller Festival, that will also be live streamed on the Web, and where the overall winner gets bragging rights and takes home our Engraved Trophy.

It will be a part of this day long Music meets Tech event, which culminates in an evening of music under the stars.

                                http://Propellerfest.com


                =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

                      Today's time trial will be held here:


TIME TRIAL:

1:15 Pilot's briefing
1:30 Walk the course
2:00 Practice runs start

        2 Practice Runs each

3:30 - 4pm Time Trials start

        2 Attempts ( your fastest time is used )

RULES: To qualify for the main races, you must be an experienced FPV racer and show proof of liability insurance coverage (AMA membership, homeowners etc.).
• Any UAV over .55lbs must be FAA registered and labeled.
• You will then compete in one of our Qualifying events for the top 12 spots with a engraved Trophy for the overall winner

The fee to compete will be $25 ($10 admin and $15 refundable if you crash out) payable by cash or check before you enter today's Qualifying time trial.

We need Marshals and Helpers. _ Spectators are welcome.

Once the Qualifying is concluded, we will continue the meeting (time allowing) as a regular Fly-In _ so don't forget to bring your non-racing birds to fly too.

If you have any questions, please eMail before the event starts.

(details are subject to change)
results.name: FPV Qualifying for the Propeller Quad Races

results.description:
Join us on Sunday, May 15th @ 1pm at Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, NJ for an interactive afternoon on Personal Branding.


How do your clients, the public, and your colleagues view you? As an educator, a guide, a leader? Perhaps you want to be seen as a coach, a friend, or partner. No matter what you want to communicate with your image – you can help shape the messages your future customers receive by tuning into your personal branding process. We’re going to show you how!

GET YOUR TICKET HERE

Join us for discussion and learning on the following topics: • What is personal branding? And how to use it to position yourself better online and in-person. • Explore the passion behind your business and how to describe it to your audience • Communicating in ways that reveal your true value and purpose • Deciding on who to market to and how to speak their language • Ways to build a network and community that supports your brand & goals.

Doors open at 12:45 PM, workshop starts at 1:00 PM sharp

GET YOUR TICKET HERE

About your hosts: 

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotos3.meetupstatic.com%2Fphotos%2Fevent%2F2%2Fb%2F2%2Fc%2F600_444551052.jpeg&sig=ADR2i7-KH9i6oldJsbDxGxJBMhfboih7oQ

Tracy Robin (@TracyRobinWR) is a Certified Life Coach & Business Mentor for entrepreneurs, an ERYT500, a Certified Kripalu Yoga Teacher, the co-owner & founder of Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, New Jersey and the director of Shine Yoga Center’s Yoga Teacher Certification Program. She is also the founder of The YogaLifeStyle with Tracy & Holistic Women Entrepreneurs Meetup. An entrepreneur & business owner since 2000, she coaches & mentors women globally on creating sustainable, high-touch, holistic lives & businesses that honor the modern day feminine in a high-tech world. She has a unique yogic approach that helps women craft their message to attract more clients, master their mindset for abundance & success in every area of their life and biz, and package, price & market their services so that they stand out as transformational leaders in a noisy, oversaturated marketplace. She travels nationally & internationally, coaching, teaching & inspiring through speaking, classes, workshops & retreats. Be sure to connect with Tracy on Facebook.

Sam Popp (@sampoppnyc) Sam is the founder of Teach + Learn Networking, a community of business owners and professionals that believe in success through connection. She’s a frequent speaker on networking and partners with businesses to help them plan events that promote their brand. 

Who can attend?

This is an event for women only - if you own a business, are a solo-preneur, freelancer, or just looking to improve your business knowledge, this is for you!

How much does it cost?

$5 online (plus service fees) or $10 at the door.  

A friendly reminder that on-street parking is available on Anderson & the side streets. Some spots are metered, some are not. If you park at a metered spot, be sure to feed it.  50 cents gives you 2 hours. :) You do not need to feed the meters on Sundays.

GET YOUR TICKET HERE

What should I bring? 

Business cards, a friend if you'd like, & an open mind.

Want to be the first to know about our upcoming events & gatherings? Interested in doing a giveaway or sponsoring our next event? Contact Tracy for more information. 

OUR SPONSOR:

We are thrilled to have Samantha Peersen, of Monster Macarons, sponsoring this Cookies & Conversation Meetup for HWE. 

"Monster Macarons, frighteningly delicious!"

[masked] & Facebook.com/monstermacarons


SPACE PARTNER 

Shine Yoga Center (@shineyoganj) is a modern yoga studio and event space in Cliffside Park, NJ, only 10 mins from NYC via the GWB. Interested in our classes or hosting your next event at Shine? Learn more at http://shineyogacenter.com/main
results.name: Cookies & Conversation: Personal Branding. How to Make YOU & YOUR SERVICES Pop!

results.description: Have you ever tried Zumba? You have a chance to take free Zumba Gold and Zumba classes this summer with Yurie Yoshida! These free classes are held in Central Park on every Sunday from May 1 to Oct 30. Zumba Gold starts at 1:30 to 2:00 pm and Zumba will be 2:00 to 2:30pm. Locations will be announced in advance on meetup.com or facebook.com/zumbawithyurie. Please register in advance, since we can only take up to 25 dancers per class. All classes are video taped so please make sure you sign the release form before each class. Looking forward to seeing you in the Park!
results.how_to_find_us: Central Park entrance @ 67th St./5th Ave.

results.description:
WALK  OVER  BROOKLYN BRIDGE TO MANHATTAN BRIDGE THEN WILLIAMSBURG BRIDGE- 6 MILE.





PICTURE OF BROOKLYN BRIDGE PICTURE  

PICTURE  OF MANHATTAN BRIDGE 

PICTURE OF WILLIAMSBURG BRIDGE



WE WILL DO WARM-UP EXERCISE LIKE THIS PICTURE OURSELVES.


UPDATE : MAY 13,2016 :


Today event time to arrived is changed to 1:30 PM. Please arrive Between 1:30Pm to 1:40 PM. We will workout and greet each other until 2:00 PM. Walk start Sharp 2:00 PM.  Please come in time. Bring your lunch if you not plan to buy at Wholefood  in their Restaurant.




Sunday, May 15,2016 at 1:30 PM -  Guided walk: Over Brooklyn Bridge to 

Manhattan Bridge then walk on crowded area of China Town on Bowery Street to 

E.Houston Street (7 block walk). Stop at WHOLEFOODS for Picnic, lunch, with 

members at their 2nd floor Cafeteria. We resume our walk for last and third bridge 

for today event to Williamsburg Bridge.We will walk over the Williamsburg Bridge to 

Brooklyn and back on the same bridge and walk along Delancy street until reach 

cross street - ESSEX street. 


Walk finished at Mcdonald on Delancy street and cross street is Essex St. We can have last sit down meeting together there. We can use Restroom there before go home. 


There is several Subway station. Subway Train F, J, M is right next to Mcdonald. There is some other train couple of block from Mcdonald. The # 6 is at Spring and Lafayette. 

You walked from Mcdonalds to mulberry, up a block and there was the station. 

FULL DETAILS OF THIS EVENT AS FOLLOWS: 


Arrive Time / City Hall Park. 1:30 PM to 1:40 AM: Please arrive between 1:30 pm to 1:40 am. Meet at the Fountain, Inside CITY HALL PARK, located nearby Park Row and Beekman St. 


We meet,greet each other and make new friends.

There is Startbucks cross the street ,use their Restroom before you start walking. 

We meet inside the CITY HALL PARK not outside the park.  

We do Stretching and breathing exercise ourselves. It will help us to warm up our body before we start walk.  Its option to do it. 

Walk start sharp at 2:00 PM : Meet at the Fountain, Inside CITY HALL PARK, located nearby Park Row and Beekman St. Join to know history and for a talk about the consolidated New York City, then walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to visit the Brooklyn for a look back to when Brooklyn was a city of its own, and return via the Manhattan Bridge. One's we reach in Brooklyn area from the Brooklyn bridge, we will head to Starbucks in DUMBO (neighborhood between the brooklyn and manhattan bridges) to use the Restroom facility there.Then, we will walk underneath of Brooklyn Bridge to get to the PARK. A beautifil small park situated bank of river between Brooklyn and Manhattan. After that,we will walk towards to Manhattan Bridge. If some one late, we set as a secondary meeting point, at Starbucks address near brooklyn bridge: 67 Front Street,Brooklyn,NY . Direction to get there: nearest stations: F train to (York st) - or you can also take A or C train to - (High st) or Train 2 or 3 to -(Clark st) and walk a bit more ESTIMATE TIME TO ARRIVE AT STARBUCKS 1:30 PM to 1:45 PM 


From Starbucks than walk to Park located underneath of the brooklyb Bridge than walk towards to Manhattan Bridge. After walk over Manhattan Bridge, we will be walking on Bowery Steet, in china Town towards to E.Houston Street.Walk 7 block to get there. 


We going to pass Delancy street before we get to E.Houston Street. We going to stop to have a picnic before we go Williamsburg Bridge at WHOLEFOODS. 95 E.Houston street.China Town. A good place to picnic and use the bathroom facility before heading off to the Williamsburg Bridge is the second floor of Wholefoods, 95 E. Houston St. (E.Houston and Bowery). Very clean. it will accomodate around and over 200 something people. On second floor walk all the way in back and turn right,there is Rest room and we will all sit near around there. You can buy your lunch there too, if you do not want to bring from your home. Its your choice. Please bring your bagpack with your lunch box,coffee or tea thermos,water etc with you. 


ESTIMATE TIME TO REACH WHOLEFOODS BETWEEN 1:45 PM TO 2:00 PM. 

ESTIMATE TIME TO LEAVE FROM WHOLEFOODS FROM 2:45 PM TO 3:00 PM.


WE SPENT ONE HOUR FOR LUNCH AND KNOWING EACH OTHER MAKE NEW FRIENDS. 


If some one like to join at WHOLEFOODS, we set as THIRD meeting point here.Please join between 4:00 PM and 4:45 PM before we leave for third bridge from here.We meet at the second floor inside the cafetaria near the Restroom area. 


Then, We walk towards to Williamsburg Bridge and then we walk over the Williamsburg Bridge and back. ESTIMATE TIME BACK FROM WILLIAMSBURG BRIDGE AND ARRIVED AT McDONALD BETWEEN 4:45 PM TO 5:00 PM. 


Tour will last approximately 4 to 5 hours, so wear comfortable winter boot/shoes, bundle of your body with very warm cloth, Muffler, hand-gloves, scarf, Hat, bring snacks,Lunch Box,Coffee or Tea Thermos,in your bagpack and bring water. Walk over the bridges might have more colder temperature. 


WE WILL MEET AT 1:30 PM. WE MEET AND GREET EACH OTHER, WORKOUT OURSELVES. WALK START SHARP AT 2:00 PM. 


RESTROOM FACILITY DURING THIS WALK: 

1.At Start point : Starbucks, Park Row and Beekman St. croos street from the City Hall park. 

2.In Brooklyn : Starbucks,67 Front Street,Brooklyn,NY . 

3.In China Town : WHOLEFOODS, 95 E.Houston Street, 

4.In China Town : Mcdonald, Delancy street/Essex st.China Town. 

WEBSITE FOR CITY HALL PARK: http://www.nycgovpark... http://www.nycgovpark... 

WEBSITE FOR BROOKLYN BRIDGE & MANHATTAN BRIDGE INFORMATION FROM NYC CITY: http://www.nyc.gov/ht... 


DIRECTION: 


SUBWAY: 4, 5, 6, J, M, Z TO "BOROUGH HALL/BROOKLYN BRIDGE" AND OTHERS SUBWAY N, R TO "CITY HALL" AND 2.3 TO "PARK PLACE " TO GO THERE.


CALL[masked] CUSTOMER SERVICE, MTA FOR SUBWAY AND BUS DIRECTION 


OR 

GO TO MTA SUBWAY,BUS WEBSITE to get timing : www.mta.info/nyct/service/schemain.htm. 

THERE WILL BE $3.00 CHARGE WILL BE COLLECTING AT THE TIME OF START.THIS CHARGE TO COVERED THE MEETUP EXPENSES.
results.name: THREE BRIDGE WALK : BROOKLYN BRIDGE TO MANHATTAN BRIDGE THEN WILLIAMSBURG BRIDGE

results.description:
Presented on a love offering basis.


Experience the powerful healing energy created in this circle of healing life, and a receive a personal healing treatment.

Justin Epstein will lead this powerful healing experience with an inspiring message and a deep and moving meditation.

Shari Shea will share her healing insights and powerful healing experiences. She says “We are the Masters of our Universe, both individually and collectively. The power to transform our lives into states of radiant health and abundant joy lies in our inherent ability to tap into the Power of Source which lies within us”.

Plus, pick up a copy of Shari’s book “Living In Grace: An Evolving Spiritual Journey” for $12 ($2 will benefit the Center).  Learn more about the book HERE.


For more information click HERE.
results.name: 'The Power To Heal' with Justin Epstein & Shari Shea

results.description:
JOIN US AND IMPROVE YOUR BUSINESS ENGLISH SKILLS BY LEARNING ESSENTIAL COMPONENTS OF "YOUR ELEVATOR PITCH"

What's to be discussed?

- What is Your Elevator Pitch? - 8 Essential Questions to answer in Your "Elevator" Pitch

- Essential Vocabulary Words to use in Your "Elevator" Pitch

- Key Phrases / Expressions to use in Your "Elevator" Pitch

For this discussion, feel free to refer to the TED Talk Video "The Elevator Speech is Out of Order" by Michelle Golden, click here for more information. This video will be discussed at the Business English Conversation Group on May 8th.

***NOTE: This event is FREE! The charge of $5 is for material, which will be provided at the event. For more information regarding this event visit www.beonwallst.com

Stay Updated & Join the Weekly Newsletter - click here!!


Looking forward to seeing you!

Jessica

results.description:
This month's LECTURE 32: The Awakening
Based on Chapter 29 from A Course in Miracles Textbook.

Joining us will be visiting Course Teacher Frances Xu, who often teaches with David Hoffmeister!

The Miracles in Manhattan lectures cover one chapter per month from the Text of A Course in Miracles. There are 31 Chapters is the Course, and the series will finish this summer. In July Jon will give a special program about dying, and in September her will begin a one-year monthly series of topical lectures on the Course, following the same schedule.

Dr. Jon Mundy met Dr. Helen Schucman, the scribe for A Course in Miracles, in 1973. Helen introduced Jon to the Course and served as his mentor and guide till she became ill in 1980. He is the author of Living A Course in Miracles. After Return to Love by Marianne Williamson, it is currently the best-selling book based on the teaching of A Course in Miracles.


Joining us this month will be Frances Xu, a Chinese Course teacher who frequently travels and teaches with David Hoffmeister. Her personal story of walking away from a successful corporate career, marriage and home to try to live completely with Holy Spirit’s guidance has inspired us and many others. She has a gift for sharing how to receive, trust, and live by guidance, and you will feel it when you are in her shining, peaceful presence.

Frances grew up in Beijing in an atheist, achievement-driven family. As an adult she moved to Australia where she worked for an investment firm and married. But she felt a strong call to explore spirituality and meditation, which led her in 2007 to A Course in Miracles. She found it difficult to understand at first, but it elicited in her a strong prompt to quit her job and start her own business to giver herself more freedom to explore — and she did. The very next day she walked into a library and picked up A Course in Miracles again and this time she felt it pouring into her like music, so much easier to understand and receive.


She met David Hoffmeister in 2009, and attended one of his retreats in Australia in 2010. One of his companions asked her, “What do you want, Frances?” She answered, “I want to fly with you guys, metaphorically and physically.” “What’s stopping you?” “I have a husband. I have a business, and I have a house.” – …..“What do you think you need to do?” “Let them go. If any of the things in my life will not support my calling, it’s time to let them go.” She moved to one of David’s communities to continue to study and eventually began traveling with David Hoffmeister and on her own, going wherever called to teach and demonstrate how to follow the Holy Spirit’s guidance with no compromise.

Following Holy Spirit’s guidance is a practice of letting go of the “I know” mind as well as the illusory personal will and preference. With deep honesty and steadfast application without exception, the self that thinks it has any control and any existence is seen as an illusion. The seeking has ended and the Mind is still. Every part of her being is in complete cooperation with the flow of life. A deep sense of harmony and peace is present. The Love that is beyond this world is shining through. Frances follows the Inspiration and joyfully goes where she is meant to be. The message of Truth pours through her and offers clarity and insight into the inner workings of the road less traveled and a life lived in divine providence.

If you feel a calling in your heart to meet her or invite her for a talk/gathering, simply click contact. You can stay connected through Frances’ Spreaker channel and YouTube channel.


----

The fee for attending the lectures is:
~ $20 per person with advanced registration ~
~ $25 per person at the door without a registration ~
Call[masked] or email [masked] to register in advance.
Your name will be on a list at the door. To pay by credit card, please register in advance. Or, you can pay with cash or a check at the door.

As long as space is available, “No one is ever turned away.”
Contribute what you can.

You will receive a monthly email reminder with the latest information on the date, time and topic. The schedule can always be found on our website:
www.miraclesmagazine.org

results.description:
this meetup will be repeating every two weeks like our veggie heaven bi weekly....
BUT, unlike our Veggie Heaven meetups, we need to have people who RSVP show up and be close to on time..........
If you need to call,[masked] 1066. please RSVP, unless you decide at the last moment to come, which is ok, if you call me. but if you decide at the last minute NOT to come, please be sure to call and tell me, so we don't reserve a table for 4 people who aren't coming, and get a chair thrown at us, or worse, a real cheese omelet.
please come on time, we will not be seated without all present, or we will be seated in increments as we show up, and will be dispersed. the management is willing to work with/accommodate us, but we need to meet them halfway, and as of late, we have not been consistent....  they want us all present before they reserve seats for us, they will not give us a table of 8 if only 4 are there in person.  they have reserved seating for 16 of us in the past only to have only 8 of us show up. they can't afford to keep seats empty waiting for no-shows during their busiest business hours. this has happened more than once. in regard to event time, the pancake house closes at 3pm, but sometimes lets customers linger. please do not count on this and show up at 3:45, it irks the management, and sometimes they do actually eject people at 3pm on the dot. please come as close to 1:30 as you can and communicate with me if you are having timeliness issues, decide at the last minute to come, or want to cancel, so we know what to expect for seating.....

as an aside, please consider;
The real reason why this event is called 'pancakes from hell'..... today(4/3/2016), we had a chair AND a REAL, really cheesy-cheese omelet thrown at us for taking up reserved chair/customer space, which lay fallow, costing the establishment moo-la. we need to be more consistent with our RSVP' status's and attendance times when it comes to our pancake events. otherwise there is hell for me to pay in my relations with this proprietor-(flames shot from his eye sockets). i am a regular at the pancake house, i live 5 blocks away, and to be a thorn in their side takes the fun out of an event, and makes patronizing their establishment on my own less pleasant for me. i don't deserve this. anyone's lack of compliance in my attendance guidelines screws up my relationship with this place of business, and i take this very personally.  please mind your RSVP's, i understand everyone here is human and might have issues, but please take my cell number and call to cancel if you choose to do so, close to, or after, attendance time. pick up the phone, it's the least you can do. please don't make me start counting indiscretions and banning people. :-(
thank you for your consideration.
results.how_to_find_us: please attend on time, or cancel if not coming. we will not be seated unless we all show. otherwise, increments of 4 or 6 will be seated, as we show up, separating us. many haven't been consistent with their RSVPs, resulting in a luke warm staff

Will your first job with the Brotherhood turn out to be as simple as it seems?

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT. 

IF YOU DON'T LIKE TO STOP IN A NUMBER OF ARTIST STUDIOS, THEN THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU. THIS WALK IS ABOUT 2 1/2 AND MODERATE PACED. YOU WILL ALSO HAVE PLENTY OF TIME TO SOCIALIZE WITH OTHERS. 

I also have scheduled this same walk on Saturday, May 14th.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo.

Description:  Now in its 20th year, TOAST (Tribeca Open Artist Studio Tour) artists will open their doors to the public and show their work. The artists don’t charge admission to their art studios. We’ll stop in some of these art studios and get a rare, intimate view of the artists’ working environment. We can talk to the artists about what they do. Some of the art studios are in 19th century tenement buildings, old industrial buildings, and cast iron structures. This art walk features painting, photography, ceramics, mixed-media, sculpture, printmaking, and dress making and designing.  

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer’s Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time/Place:  The meeting time is (after lunch) at 2:00 PM. The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Barnes & Noble Bookstore at 97 Warren Street in the Tribeca neighborhood. Before the walk, restrooms are available in Barnes & Noble or Bed Bath & Beyond (Both have the same building entrance.)

Transportation Options:  Take the 1, 2, or 3 subway train to Chambers Street, which is about two blocks away, or take the A or C subway train to Chambers Street, which is about three blocks away.

Finishing Time/Place:  The walk will finish between 5:00 PM and 5:15 PM somewhere in the Tribeca neighborhood.

Only heavy rain or rain with windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is heavy rain or rain with windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Sunday morning (before 10:00 AM). If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If it is raining, I will just bring an umbrella. (We will be spending half the time inside these artist studios anyway. Plus, this event is held only once a year, so there is no rain date to reschedule it.)

Below are figure sculptures by Nancy B. Pantirer.

Below are paintings by C.J. Collins.

Below are paintings by Judy Somerville.
results.name: Tribeca Artist Studio Walk (May 15)

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Agricola, Tzolkin, etc.) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. In addition, many take a long time to teach (Alchemists runs about 30 minutes, Kanban's teach ran 1 hour last time).  Among the shortest games we play are Codenames and Splendor.  If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game. Towards the late evening, Avalon often happens.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.

Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, the card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.

Disclosure Network New York

Date: Sunday, May 15, 2016

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), elevator to the 5th Floor, Room 505, NYC

Time: 2pm-4pm,Please be on time as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting. Enter the room assigned at 2pm. Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment” if you need help in finding the room. Enter the room assigned at 2pm.

Topic: “World War II: Why Did the United States Not Win”

Featured Guest Speaker: LORRAINE GIBNEY

Program (Live Event): During World War II, American history tells its people that they won the war against the Axis Powers. Nevertheless, the evidence backing these allegations tell a different story. In the United States, the government gives asylum to German war criminals in the United States under different alias. Moreover, the Nazis work in the United States government working in high positions of science, psychology, politics, government and commerce. In addition, there is overwhelming evidence that Adolf Hitler fled to South America during “Operation Winnie the Pooh”, and Israel was a farce for the Rothchild destiny. Some might even claim that the Nazis were in truth the American government!

Bio: Lorraine Gibney is a writer, artist and lecturer. She is interested in the bizarre and occult. For many years she has been researching World War II and history related to that part of the world. Currently, Ms. Gibney lives in West New York, New Jersey; however. she is a native of New York City.

results.description:
This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending.  Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group.

HOW MEMBERS SUBMIT NOVEL SECTIONS:



Email your submission to [masked] 

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam
MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.
Send to [masked]

Attach your document. RTF and DOC are preferred. Please, NO PDF's or DOCx. 


What to Expect: Nine days before the meeting you will receive an email from Meetup with links to download each story for critique from our Dropbox account. Click on the link and download the stories.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.


Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next. You can find advice about how to give a critique here.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!

Hello Coffee Hunters! Spring is here and it's been awhile so what better way to welcome the warm weather than with beer and coffee! 

Let's train our palettes to be more perceptive to food and beverage flavors! Join the Coffee Hunters to taste coffee by Uptown Roasters and beer by the Bronx Brewery. We'll learn how perceived flavors in coffee and beer change when paired with different food items. Discover new dimensions of local coffee, beer, and the best the Bronx has to offer. 


The coffee and food tasting exercise will be led by Uptown Coffee Roasters and Rachel Northrop, author of When Coffee Speaks. If you would like to do the beer and cheese flight from the Bronx Brewery, just RSVP on this Eventbrite link and we will have it ready for you during the event (it's $15 for the beer and cheese flight).

We will be getting together at the Bronx Brewery for this event and feel free to stick around after (their Backyard is open!) for some beers and bites. Can't wait to see you guys there for some good coffee and beer, to #supportlocal and learn to hone our tasting skills! results.description:
We sent out a short, 10-question Member Survey via an email blast to all of our Members on April 13, 2016.  Based on the results of that survey we are scheduling this next MeetUp!


If you have not yet responded to that survey, by all means do so and let us know where your favorite dog runs are so that we may schedule future MeetUps there too!  

I have to admit that I have passed the DiMattina Dog Run literally thousands of times on my detour route to Manhattan via Hicks Street when the BQE is clogged up, but I have NEVER noticed it as a dog run!  Thanks to one of our Members, Leslie, I was finally introduced to this "hidden jewel" in Brooklyn and actually visited it with Rusty and Miley this past weekend.

Needless to say, I was very impressed by the intimate, cozy feeling you get from this dog run... not too big, not too small... "just right" and with all the bells and whistles to boot!

It offers two fully fenced areas:  one for small/medium dogs and one for large dogs.  It has two doggie water fountains, two "hose down" stations to clean up the canine kids when they are ready to leave, lots of shade from trees, ample seating areas for the humans and it even has a plastic doggie pool to cool off the pooches in hot weather!

The only negative I found was the lack of restroom facilities for the Beagle People. 

You'll have to settle for McDonald's restrooms (within walking distance) after you insert a quarter coin into the door's lockset... that, and the fact that the fine sand/pebble ground surface tends to generate lots of dust when the canines run around (as they should)!

So wear a dust mask if you must, or deal with it, for the Beagles' sake!  Rusty and Miley did not mind at all...!

Street parking is available near the park (if you are lucky) or on the adjacent residential streets just one or two blocks away.

For a preview, here are the videos I took when I was there a few days ago:

https://youtu.be/9PnKM58kJwA

https://youtu.be/oNy7saj_K4A

https://youtu.be/xA2Gze7J07c

IMPORTANT:  

Attendance at this MeetUp event is purely voluntary and you do so at your own risk. 

By attending this MeetUp event you agree to hold harmless MeetUp.com, The Beagle Pack!, its Organizers and its Members, who assume NO liability for any injury, accident, loss of property or loss of life resulting from the use of this facility, or traveling to and from this facility; nor can they be held responsible for the actions of any aggressive dogs, irresponsible dog owners or patrons, or any hazardous conditions at the facility.

results.description:
May 15, 3:00pm
French & German Art Song Recital
with pianists, Thomas Grubb & Thomas Muraco
at Christ & St. Stephen’s Church (120 West 69th Street)
Legendary pianists Thomas Grubb & Thomas Muraco will join with rising stars Robert Brandt (baritone), Sahoko Sato Timpone (mezzo), Emily D'Angelo (mezzo) and Winnie Nieh (soprano) in an evening of French & German song.

Thomas Grubb, French Vocal Repertoire (The Juilliard School of Music) -  Thomas Grubb is the famed author of Singing in French: A Manual of French Diction and French Vocal Repertoire (Schirmer Books, 1979, with a Foreword by Pierre Bernac). Mr. Bernac eventually became his primary mentor and the inspiration for his specialization in French Vocal Repertoire. As a performing pianist, Thomas Grubb has appeared in recital with Renée Fleming, Elly Ameling, Benita Valente, Eleanor Steber, Elizabeth Mannion and Dawn Upshaw, plus numerous others. Mr. Grubb was decorated as Chevalier dans l’ordre des Arts et des Lettres by the French Ministry of Culture in Paris for his advancement of French culture throughout the world. He currently teaches at The Juilliard School in NYC.

Thomas Muraco,  French  & German Vocal Repertoire (The Manhattan School of Music) -  Thomas Muraco has earned such accolades through a combination of technical virtuosity, tonal beauty, and a unique understanding of the underlying poetry of music.  His performances in major concert halls throughout the United States, Canada, Central America, Europe, and Asia reflect his command of a repertoire remarkable for its complete range of musical styles, periods and forms. Mr. Muraco has partnered among others such singers as Adele Addison, John Aler, Martina Arroyo, Arleen Augér, John Cheek, Phyllis Curtin, Mary Dunleavy, Faith Esham, Maureen Forrester, Denyce Graves, Ben Heppner, Henry Herford, Ying Huang, Sumi Jo, Chris Merritt, Roberta Peters, Hermann Prey, Twyla Robinson, Jennie Tourel, Benita Valente and Dolora Zajick, and instrumentalists John Graham, Robert Mann, Arnold Steinhardt, Zara Nelsova, Ransom Wilson, Peter Winograd,  and the American and Shanghai String Quartets.

Click here for a free Online Webinar:

</a>

<a href="https://www.innerengineering.com/">Inner Engineering is a resource that can help with your self-help and self-improvement journey whether you are a veteran or a beginner. Sadhguru, a yogi and mystic, and one of the foremost authorities on yoga, offers his characteristically pragmatic wisdom for a life of joy and fulfillment. Starting with four basic dimensions of the self –Body, Mind, Emotions, and Energy – Sadhguru introduces us to simple techniques to realign and transform them into a life of sparkling aliveness.

Inner Engineering is a method of enhancing yourself and emerging into the ideal way you want to be. It is a 7-session online course that provides tools and solutions to empower yourself to create your life the way you want it. It gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods from the distilled essence of yogic sciences. The course provides a simple, easy to use, proven methods to empower yourself for self-empowerment.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru
results.name: Introductory Class (Free Webinar)

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3-5pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is free with a suggested donation of $10.  The donation would go to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.facebook.com/improvnow


Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Hey everyone! Join us for our monthly introspective meetup, where we look into ourselves and try to figure out how to be better profeminist men. This month we'll look at two topics and discuss them for 30 minutes each:

***1. Clinic escorting debrief***
How did you find the April clinic escorting event? Please note that those of us who did not attend the escorting event are totally welcome to attend this debrief.

***2. De-escalation***
Where do you draw the line between positive intervention and benevolent sexism? Tenure She Wrote (https://tenureshewrote.wordpress.com/2015/12/08/men-if-you-really-want-to-support-women-take-your-feminism-to-eleven/) argues that profeminist men should step in and "intervene when you witness women being abused, harassed, or assaulted... talk to each other, and figure it out." How do you reconcile this with a respect for women's agency? Have you ever intervened when you witnessed a man abusing a woman and, if so, how did it go?
results.name: Introspective

results.description:
SHE’S BEAUTIFUL WHEN SHE’S ANGRY resurrects the buried history of the outrageous, often brilliant women who founded the modern women’s movement from 1966 to 1971. SHE’S BEAUTIFUL takes us from the founding of NOW, with ladies in hats and gloves, to the emergence of more radical factions of women’s liberation; from intellectuals like Kate Millett to the street theatrics of W.I.T.C.H. (Women’s International Conspiracy from Hell!). Artfully combining dramatizations, performance and archival imagery, the film recounts the stories of women who fought for their own equality, and in the process created a world-wide revolution. SHE’S BEAUTIFUL does not try to romanticize the early movement, but dramatizes it in its exhilarating, quarrelsome, sometimes heart-wrenching glory. The film does not shy away from the controversies over race, sexual preference and leadership that arose in the women’s movement. SHE’S BEAUTIFUL WHEN SHE’S ANGRY captures the spirit of the time --- thrilling, scandalous, and often hilarious.

That story still resonates today for women who are facing new challenges around reproductive rights and sexual violence, as the film shows present-day activists creating their generation's own version of feminism. SHE’S BEAUTIFUL WHEN SHE’S ANGRY is a film about activists, made to inspire women and men to work for feminism and human rights. For more information please visit: http://www.shesbeautifulwhenshesangry.com/
results.name: Movie Screening - "She's Beautiful When Shes Angry" with Q&A

For more info on Trumpets, please go to http://www.trumpetsjazz.com/ Trumpets is a very small place, and I don't want anyone being turned away. Please update your rsvp if you can't make it. If you are certain you want to go to this, you should buy your ticket in advance. I do recommend calling before you leave home to see if you can get in. I strongly suggest buying your ticket in advance, or at least calling . I will need  volunteers to take pictures to post on meetup, of both my band  performance   and of yourselves. I can't do it; I'll be on stage.  My ensemble goes up either first or second. 

This is a multi-group event (5 groups) so please  get your ticket.  About 60 RSVPed so far. 

Afterwards, we can  go to my place (about 3 miles, very easy) for coffee, desert, and drinks,  on me.  


Note: The "after party" is exclusively for people who attend the concert.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the meetup tables when you buy your ticket, and when you arrive. Say hi to me after my show!
results.name: Live Jazz Concert Montclair Trumpets Multi group
