results.description:
A place to learn. cook. And vibe.

Anthony Brown, son of Caribbean chefs is a native New Yorker with an ever-evolving passion for cooking, healthy food, physical fitness and spiritual awareness. In the comfort of his condo apartment, Anthony offers recreational cooking classes within an open, elaborate kitchen space.


New Taste, Each Class

During these “hands-on” cooking class students learn easy, innovative cooking techniques in a team building manner. Additionally, each class incorporates various raw spices and seasoning used to flavor various dishes from every corner of the culinary world – American, Caribbean, Italian, Thai and more. Most classes conclude with generous portions. Anthony would not want you to walk away hungry!


Classes are suitable for all levels of cooking expertise and make a great team building activity or way to spend quality time with a friend.

Cost: $50/Person. Covers all food ingredients, eating utensils, and recipe notes provided.

Up to 4 students per class. 2 Hours. 

Event RSVP notification will include central Harlem meeting location.

results.description:
If anyone has spent more than a few minutes with me recently, then you know exactly how excited I am about this film. Isn't the trailer just adorable?? http://www.lobsterfilm.co.uk/trailer 

In this highly imaginative, delightfully absurdist comedy from visionary director Yorgos Lanthimos (Dogtooth), Colin Farrell stars as David, a man who has just been dumped by his wife. To make matters worse, David lives in a society where single people have 45 days to find true love, or else they are turned into the animal of their choice and released into the woods. David is kept at the mysterious hotel while he searches for a new partner, and after several romantic misadventures decides to make a daring escape to abandon this world.


Winner, Jury Prize, Cannes Film Festival 2015

Meetup Details:
We will be attending the 3:40pm showtime; I'll post a link to purchase tickets once it's available. Everyone is responsible for purchasing their own ticket.

I will be standing in the lobby a half hour ahead of time, and will walk into the theater @ 15 minutes prior to showtime. If we get separated, we can regroup outside after the film. A coffee or wine venue will be chosen nearby for post-film discussion. I'll post contact details on the morning of the meetup.

See you there!
results.name: Indie Film Series: 'The Lobster' @ AMC Loews Lincoln Square 13

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ Frederick Douglass Playground


                                 Check our Facebook page:

              facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer 

                          NO CLEATS OR PLASTIC STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=41MNlrZf-MY

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 7 on 7, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 9:00 am on Sunday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

1-First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

2-Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

3-No power shots allowed.

4-If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

5-If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.


6-Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location:

Frederick Douglass Playground


Take the 1,2 or 3 RED Line Train to 96th street Station and walk 4 blocks down, to 101st Street and Amsterdam Ave. or the 1 RED Line Train to 103rd Street Station and walk 1 block.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S. 

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes(No CLEATS), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Royale for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                       Lion’s Head Tavern 

                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

This is a fun, Open level class that begins with the fundamental basics of Salsa dancing!

The class begins with basic footwork and turns, so that students can become comfortable with these fundamental movements. The class will cover a variety of different topics, including, musicality, partnering and connection, turns, shines, and proper technique. Students will also learn a fun and flashy dance pattern to dance on their next Latin vacation!

No experience is needed, and no partner is necessary!

You can also find us on Facebook, Spirare Dance.

results.description:
Welcome back everyone! Come <a>play</a> some <a>beach volleyball</a> :) <a>Games</a> will be 4x4, rotating 3 teams, rally scoring to 15. 

Things to Know: Wondering what intermediate means? <a>Simply</a> put, you know what second ball means, and you can bump, set and spike.

Over all you can receive a <a>serve</a> and get it to the setter, reliably serve  and hot the ball over the net.  

Here is a <a>video</a> of the level of <a>play</a> we <a>expect</a> at the bare minimum . 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Nf4aM-hEzE

But this is how we think we <a>play</a>...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zmfd9etbXGE

We are a fun and friendly group. Any arguments over calls will be a redo.

• "Daria plays" are discouraged, but you get one freebie.

• Dancing between plays is allowed! 

• <a>Open</a> invites to drinks/ <a>lemonade</a> after the game :) Losers can drown their sorrows. 

• Sorry guys no refunds on day of cancellations!

• PLEASE LET US KNOW IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT.  Two no shows = ban for a month. 

Where is it?

Pier 25 is located by the <a>West Side Highway</a> between North Moore St. and Harrision St. It's the first Pier north of <a>Battery</a> Park City.

http://pier25.com/location/

Closest <a>subways</a> are: Canal (A, C, E), Franklin St. (1), <a>Chambers</a> on the (A,C, 2,or 3)

This week we will be <a>playing</a> at an Intermediate <a>level</a>. Bumping and setting consistently, and no carrying allowed. If you are unsure if you are at the <a>required level</a>, please <a>message</a> Joe and he will inform you if you can <a>sign up</a>. If you do sign up and are not at that level, you will be asked to sit this one out and refunded your payment. We will have an <a>open play</a> <a>meet up</a> again next week. Thanks!

results.description:
This is the first meeting of our group!! We had planed to invite some guest who are very familiar with Japanese history this time, but it was canceled so that we have changed the date to gather also. Sorry for that. Our first meeting moved from May 7th to 15th so please re-schedule the date. I hope we can meet you! 

第一回目の会合として、スペシャルゲストをお招きして開催したいと予定していましたが、都合によりキャンセルとなりましたので、それに伴い集まる日にちも変更させていただきました。ご迷惑をお掛けし、誠にすいません。しかし、今度ばかりは第１回の会合を開催させていただきたいと思いますので、どうぞご参加いただけばと思います！！

それではお会いできるを楽しみしております！！共に日本の歴史と文化の良さを見直し、後世に、そして世界に伝えてまいりましょう！！（タイトルはとても固くてとっきつにくいでしょうが、リフレッシュメントも用意し、みなさんと和気藹々と親睦を深めれ場としたいと思っておりますので、どうぞお気軽にご参加下さい！！）

results.description:
This film is part of the Panorama Europe 2016  series at the museum:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nN5PvNQq86E

Presented by the Goethe-Institut New York

New York premiere. Germany. Dir. Lars Kraume. 2015, 
105 mins. In German, English, and Yiddish, and Spanish with English subtitles. With Burghart Klaussner, Ronald Zehrfeld, Sebastian Blomberg. 

The true story of one man’s relentless quest to bring Nazi war criminals to justice provides the basis for this gripping drama. While much of Germany was eager to bury its Nazi past by the late 1950s, Jewish lawyer Fritz Bauer (an incredible performance by The White Ribbon’s Burghart Klaussner) risks everything—including charges of treason—to track down and prosecute Adolf Eichmann, the infamous architect of the Final Solution. Told with the verve of a good thriller, The People vs. Fritz Bauer sheds light on an incredible, stranger-than-fiction slice of history. A Cohen Media Group release. 


Tickets: $12 (Free for members at the Film Lover and MoMI Kids Premium levels and above). Order tickets online. (Members may contact [masked] with any questions regarding online reservations.)  

Since events of this kind typically sell out, I strongly recommend that you order your tickets early.

UPDATE:  All extra tickets to the series have been claimed.

Please be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates regarding this event.

Originally posted 5/1/16. 
First update on 5/11/16.

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/

results.description:
We are now offering Intro to Yoga classes once a week. Come join us in May for some basics and fun in a semi-private atmosphere. This class series is perfect for those who are new to yoga or would like to return to the basics. In these introduction classes, you will learn basic moves, conscious breathing, foundational poses, correct alignment, and techniques to relax and focus. You do not need to be flexible, athletic or injury-free to join this class! Everyone is welcome.

WHEN:
- May 1, 2016, 5:00-6:30
- May 8, 2016, 5:00-6:30
- May 15, 2016, 5:00-6:30
- May 22, 2016, 5:00-6:30

Space is Limited, please register in advance.

results.description:
Dear Performers,

The April meetup was huge success! Thank you so much. 

Please notice the change of the date. As I mentioned, my place isn't ready until the original day (8th), and if I don't have a host I can host the meetup on the 15th at my new place. (Also the 8th is mother's day, so you don't have to choose between your mother and your instrument)

If you have something you want to read, please post here, so other performers could prepare for it. If not, we will have plenty of music to read, so please come in with an open mind. 

Here are some of repertoire we read on April Meetup:

Corelli Violin Sonata A Minor

Mozart Flute Quartet

Beethoven Trio Opus 11

Beethoven String Quintet Opus 29

Mendelssohn String Quartet Opus 13

Brahms Piano Quartet Opus 60 in C Minor

Brahms Violin Sonata No.3

Martinu Flute Trio

Liebermann Struwwelpeterlieder (Voice, Piano, Viola)

Hope to see you soon!

results.description:
Are you a writer in search of a writing group. Do you live in Inwood/Northern Manhattan? We are inviting all writers, of all skill levels, to join a newly formed Writer’s Group.

We are two writers who need looking to jump start our own practice and want a group that supports the process. Writing can be a very isolating process so we are forming a group who can help support and stimulate this process. We want this time together to open readings of our work, guided critiques and exploring genres written by authors of color. Writers will be encouraged to share resources, creative influences, along with individual practices.

We will meet once a week for eight weeks. Our goals are to expand as writers, create a space for writers of color, allow for safe critique, and stimulate creative growth. Our workshop will focus on the beginning, middle and conclusion of a written piece for future publication and/or sheer pleasure.

As Inwood is an vibrant backdrop, we will search out locations easily accessible to all that offer us a taste of our neighborhood spots. Suggestions are welcome.

The writers group will host a Public Reading in Inwood/Northern Manhattan (location to be determined) at the end of the eight weeks.

For more information, contact:

Glorya:[masked]

Brannon: ([masked])
results.name: Join Inwood/Northern Manhattan Writers Group!

results.description:
Join us aboard the 100-foot, two-level party yacht The Cabana, as we cruise around Manhattan, take a look at amazing views of the NYC skyline, statue of liberty, and more! Over 200 singles ages 20s, 30s, and early 40s will be in attendance, and DJ HA will be spinnin' dance music of the past-present.

CRUISE RUNS FROM 6 TO 10PM

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$25 for our members

Prepay only - Prepay here

http://singlescruisemay.eventbrite.com

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off other select events from our calendar (wine tastings, boat cruises, speeddating, advanced degree events, mix & migfle happy hour.  fireman parties.) Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

We’ll have complimentary appetizers, fun ice breakers, prizes, and two levels & two cash bars. Our singles sunset cruise gets sold out every year—you won’t want to miss it! Love will be in the air and drinks will be flowing...

Expect to meet singles ages 25-45. This is a multi-group event organized by NYMinuteDating.com

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is heated and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 5:45pm.  The boat will depart at 6pm SHARP!  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leaders - Joanne & LD)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

[masked]

Swing 46- Supper Club
349 West 46th Street (Between 8th and 9th)
Sunday, May 15th
6:00 pm optional drinks, 7pm Dinner
$79 3-course meal, gl of wine, music charge, dance lessons
Note: This event is part of my dinner group, The Single Gourmet. We will have 20-30 people from my dinner group at this event. If you are interested in joining this event, please go to www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/swing46/
meetup members can attend 1-2 events before joining our membership-only group and only some of our events are posted on meetup.

Big Band and swing dance lessons from 8:30-11:30pm Join us for a great meal and a live Big Band at Swing 46 Jazz and Supper Club. NYC’s swing dance community raves about this supper club which has live music six nights a week. If you want to Lindy Hop, Jitterbug, Waltz, or Freestyle we will be doing it all. If you do not know how to swing dance, dance lessons are included and offered in between the band break. “Nice casual” is the dress code (no sneakers or jeans). We ate here 2 years ago and the band was incredible (8-10 piece band), the music spectacular and the dance lessons well worth it! Typical music and lesson charge is $25 for others, but it is included for us

results.description:
Members keep asking when's our first cruise this year... well, here it is!  Join 200+ singles (ages 21-49) from several Meetup groups & set sail around Manhattan for a 4 hour private tour & party!  

Mix, mingle, drink & dance the night away with a panoramic view of the NYC skyline, Statue Of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, Freedom Tower etc. on a 100 ft, 2-deck private yacht. 

This is a multi-Meetup and very popular event!  It will SELL OUT so if you'd like to attend, please get your ticket ASAP.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. GET YOUR TICKETS HERE

What's included:

• Free Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

50% off limited tickets available for $25 ($50 otherwise) Only 25 available at this price so get them before they're gone! 

MUST PREPAY HERE  (No tix will be sold at door)

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is heated and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 5:45pm.  The boat will depart at 6pm SHARP!  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual".  Age range is 21-49. Not meant be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced.

• You must get your ticket in advance.  RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event.  We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending.  We have several groups co-organizing and will have 200+ attending.

Here's a video taken from one our past cruises -

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LViOu6VHBY

GET TICKETS HERE (No tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/finalcruise/dates/May-15-2016_at_0600PM

group.name: The Best NYC Singles Parties & Social Events

results.description:
Hosted by Team New York Aquatics. Coached by Bob.

Welcomes all levels including beginners.

Free for first timers. Bring goggles, swimsuit, towel, and lock for gym locker.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in. Pool is straight ahead. Tell the desk you're there for water polo.
results.name: TNYA hosts All Level Water Polo

results.description:
Rock Climbing! Top of our popular events! Join our amazing group of men and women of color as we defy gravity, cheer each other on and have a great time!.

We're all hooked. Fitness, fun and conquering fears what's not to love. 

Belay Class & Cert is an option, don't let it stop you from coming out on any date. They have Automatic Belays so don't so sweat it.

Excited about this! We've got some great group rates! & We do this once a month.

Note: We have a strict 4 No-Shows without word and your out of the community policy, so update your RSVP @ least 3 hours before if plans change so we can better accommodate folks (Don't Say I Ain't told you).


Price: $24 What! (Includes shoes & harness) 

• Interested in Cliffs Membership see BPLOA Special Group Rates.

Beginners welcome! - No beginner class today but there are staff & myself in the beginners area that can show you the ropes before we start.

Dinner/ BBQ - will follow a few blocks away! (Ohh That Corn Bread Tho). 

Bring a small padlock for the locker if you have one!

Transportation: 

Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

See Old Pics: * Rock Climbing 11/29 

       *Rock Climbing Intro 1/10 Photos.

Below: View Beginner Rock Climbing Video. So you don't look brand new :-)


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gLfvk2SSj1c&list=PL-tQqcPz8GJBOC5WurzR7D3F3B8Ag5wgc

Questions, Comments, Concerns: Leave a comment. To Suggest a meetup: Send me a message!.
results.name: Rock Climbing & Tight Roping

This is a multi-Meetup and very popular event!  It will SELL OUT so if you'd like to attend, please get your ticket ASAP.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. GET YOUR TICKETS HERE

What's included:

• Free Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

50% off limited tickets available for $25 ($50 otherwise) Only 25 available at this price so get them before they're gone! 

MUST PREPAY HERE  (No tix will be sold at door)

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is heated and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 5:45pm.  The boat will depart at 6pm SHARP!  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual".  Age range is 21-49. Not meant be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced.

• You must get your ticket in advance.  RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event.  We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending.  We have several groups co-organizing and will have 200+ attending.

Here's a video taken from one our past cruises -

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LViOu6VHBY

GET TICKETS HERE (No tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/finalcruise/dates/May-15-2016_at_0600PM

results.description:
Advanced degrees suggested by not required.

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off other select events from our calendar (wine tastings, boat cruises, speeddating, advanced degree events, fireman parties.) Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Nahko and Medicine for the People is an American world music musical collective formed in 2008. The five member group is headed by frontman Nahko Bear and their music is a fusion of various cultural musical influences. 


Nahko Bear is an American musician. He was born in Portland, Oregon. He has a mixed ethnic background which includes Apache, Puerto Rican, and Filipino descent. He began playing piano at age six. His creative inspiration is the desire to bridge cultural gaps.

Nahko and Medicine for the People
w/ Kim Churchill
Sunday May 15, 2016
Doors: 6:00 PM
Show: 8:00 PM
21 and over
$25

results.description:
Are you craving deeper connections in your life?

Do you want to experience more awareness/presence in your day to day life ?

Do you ever have the feeling that you could be enjoying richer more authentic interactions with people?

Sometimes creating profound connection is as easy as looking just beneath the surface with whoever we are with, at any given time and simply being more present with what actually is.

Join The Connection Movement and Authentic Relating NYC at Reflections Yoga for social games that invite us beneath the surface and into a deeper experience of ourselves and others.

Authenticity Games are a fun, highly-interactive partner and group exercise that explore ways of seeing, connecting, appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level. They are a safe and structured way for us to go beyond small talk and beyond superficial appearances.

It’s an opportunity for us to have fun and celebrate with great people who are also wanting to explore what’s possible in connection.

Join us for some fun relational games, socializing, and snacks

Bring a friend, or come alone and meet some awesome new people.

When we celebrate and explore what makes each of us unique, we often end up realizing just how much we all have in common.

Games Night begins at 6:30 pm and will wrap up around 9:30 pm - we generally visit, eat, socialize, do acro-yoga, and hang out in cuddle-piles after the games wrap up. Hope you'll plan on lingering with us.

TO PAY IN ADVANCE: http://relatinggames.eventbrite.com/

Payment:
$30 at the door
$25 in advance

Reflections Yoga
227 East 24th Street
between 3rd and 2nd

(NOTE - the address for Reflections on Google Maps and Reflections' mobile site have not been updated to indicate the NEW location on East 24th Street)

Follow The Connection Movement on Facebook
www.facebook.com/theconnectmove

For updates on authentic relating events in New York, join our Meetup or Facebook groups

http://www.meetup.com/connectionmovement

https://www.facebook.com/groups/authenticrelatingnyc/

results.description: Join the Animal Cruelty Exposure Fund in protesting "artist" Duke Riley's "show", "Fly By Night", wherein he coerces two thousand pigeons to fly at night with LED lights attached to them. Pigeons do not behave like this naturally. It is believed that a pigeon's vision is extremely limited in the dark, and thus, they are disturbed, or perhaps even frightened, to fly at night. ACEF says, this "show" is just another example of animal exploitation. Please join us, as we educate the public, and the “artist”, that animals are not ours to use for entertainment.
results.name: Protest Use of Live Pigeons in "Art" Show in Brooklyn on Sunday!

results.description:
2 Dance Groups Attending This Event!

Come out for a dance workshop on Salsa & Bachata @ The Wellness On The Green Studio In Morristown NJ On Sunday May 15th.

The class will start promptly at 6:30pm. Will include a split class for salsa & some bachata of beginner & advance levels. About An Hour For The Class. We will conclude the workshop with a practice session to rehearse everything you've learn to music. About 1.5 Hour duration for this workshop. You may want to bring a bottle of water and don't forget to wear comfortable shoes.

$10 Per Person.

Come out and join the group for this workshop. Your guaranteed to have fun, meet some wonderful people, and learn some new dance moves along the way.

The studio is located Above the E-Trade Building. Free street parking available. No fee on Sundays. Also parking lot garages in the area but there is a charge if you use them.

Info On Salsa & Bachata:

Salsa- A very popular dance and musical style often heard and danced at latin clubs all over the world. There are many different variations to it, but some very basic fundamental moves and timing structure that are fairly common. Becoming a really good salsa dancer like any other skill requires practice & repetition, but the reward of being able to move effortlessly on the dance floor is more than enough reason to Practice, Practice, Practice!!!

Bachata- A sexy sensual dance that has really become popular over the last decade. Although not considered as difficult a dance as the salsa. It also has it's share of difficult patterns as one progresses through the learning stages. The bachata sound is fairly easy to identify with its pronounced guitar sound & constant percussion tap on the fourth beat. It's becoming a dance that is essentially a must learn dance to be able to use it at any latin night!

results.description:
Sunday Evening at Heights Meditation is a great way to either end your week or begin your week (or both!) with others similarly-minded, those seeking clarity of mind and open-heartedness in their everyday lives.

The Sunday evening meeting normally begins with some chant as a means to center the self and lighten up. We like to think of it as a kind of spiritual singalong, and who doesn't like a singalong? We use several easy-to-learn and different Sanskrit texts and leave it to members to choose a chant they'd like the group to use on a particular evening. If you have never chanted before, come along and try out this wonderful spiritual tool. It doesn't matter if it seems strange to you--the point is precisely to buck oneself out of a sense of 'ordinary' life--or if you think you are completely atonal. You will probably derive a lot of benefit from doing chant, and it can lastingly help you forward in life.

After the chanting ends, we immediately go into silent meditation for 20-25 minutes. Whereas chant tends to focus and energize the body and mind, silent meditation tends to quiet and calm the mind. It's a perfect counterpoint to the chanting.

As you can see, then, the Sunday evening meetings are a kind of dual spiritual exercise: of energizing and focusing the mind (chant) and then relaxing and calming it (meditation).

Come along to this or our other meetings if you feel you'd like to live a happier, calmer life and be able to live fearlessly through the cares and worries of modern life. If you can find a way to slow down and live more mindfully, you are well on the way to being an agent of joy and serenity in your own life and the lives of those living around you.

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

Blondies has been a great supporter for CRC events over the years and this is a nice way to thank them by showing our support for the local businesses that support us. They are an sports bar with a very casual atmosphere. You can sit at the bar, stand and socialize or sit at tables with others.We have the back room reserved


Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish

Week #3 New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Sun, May 01 - Sun, Jun 19, 2016
  Except 5-29 and 6-12
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
    102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  jccmanhattan.org/dance </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358">

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135393">

I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Ari Shaffir, Gregory K. Nick Griffin, Greer Barnes, Godfrey, Christian Finnegan, Jon Laster, Damien Lemon and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

PLEASE RSVP TO THE SECOND SCREEN!! (WAITLIST NOW BEING SENT TO SECOND SCREEN)

Episode 4 "Book of the Stranger"

All are welcome. If you are a fan of the HBO Game of Thrones and want to join a group of fellow fans, come on in. If you are a full fledged Maester who has read all of the books (and even the extras like Dunk & Egg) come join us and watch the marvelous series with a group of fellow Maesters. Discussion about anything we just watched is encouraged here (and since the show has passed the books, talk about the books is also encouraged). This group does not consider mentioning Ned Stark's beheading in Season 1 during Season 6 to be a spoiler.*

There is a delicious and very affordable menu of food and drinks for you to enjoy when you get here.

8PM

Discuss, debate, and compare notes while watching last week's show.

9PM

Watch new episode (without debate or talking so we don't miss anything).

10PM

Socialize and discuss the show.

Come early to get the best seats.

*It is highly recommended that people who consider a wide range of topics to be spoilers watch the show alone at home with the doors locked and the internet disconnected. Make sure to also avoid all news outlets.

results.description:
Ok folks, it's the third Sunday of the month, again- the day you all get to have a great time being being horrible people with a rousing game of Cards Against Humanity. Because so many of you enjoy it, we decided it was best to give you monthly recurring opportunities to be horrible. I'm sure we're doing a great service providing a safe outlet for these urges.

We'll be playing at The Uncommons, a tabletop gaming cafe. If by any chance Cards Against Humanity isn't your thing, they literally have a menu of dozens of games for you to enjoy, along with more typical menus for things like food and drink. For the small fee of $5 plus tax, all of these things will be available to you for the entire evening (The games, not the food and drink).

So come out and enjoy the guilty pleasure of being acceptably horrible with a card game, or play another game and sit in quiet judgment of the rest of us (both options have their appeal). Either way, join us for some fun games and good company this weekend.

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Window Light

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.

results.description:
This month we welcome Muthu Muthukrishnan from Rutgers University!  Refreshments will be provided at 10:30am and the talk will begin at 11:00am. 


Speaker:  Muthu Muthukrishnan, Rutgers


Title:  Data Stream Algorithms: New Directions

Abstract:  There is a two decades long history of algorithms for dealing with data streams with small --- sublinear --- resources like space, time and communication. In this talk, I will review some of the achievements in this area, and will discuss emerging directions including stochastic streams, graphical models, graph and matrix algorithms and others. These methods have applications in statistical data analysis and machine learning, social data analysis and analytics for modern Big Data systems. 


Bio:  Muthu is a Professor at Rutgers University. His research interest is in algorithms, in particular, data stream algorithms and online advertising. He has a blog: http://mysliceofpizza.blogspot.com/.
results.name: Muthu Muthukrishnan, Rutgers

Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.

results.description:
Zhang Yang’s Paths of the Soul

China. 2015. Directed by Zhang Yang. Courtesy of Icarus Films and KimStim. In Tibetan; English subtitles. 115 min.


A group of Tibetans of all ages and from different families join together to make a pilgrimage from their home village to Lhasa, and around sacred Mount Kailash. Each makes the spiritual journey for their own reasons—one man, now elderly, may never have another opportunity, and a younger man seeks to change his fate. Over the course of an arduous trek that requires prostration after every few steps, they encounter many obstacles—a broken tractor, snow, exhaustion, sickness, a birth—but the ordeal never breaks their communal resolve. This unique blend of fiction and documentary uses real events to inform its dramatic storyline.


For admissions and visitor information  click here: http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#filmticketing
Be advised that MoMA members can now reserve tickets 2 weeks in advance.
results.name: MoMA Presents: Zhang Yang’s Paths of the Soul

results.description:
Come experience the holistic healing modality of Core Energetics!


Please note that this Meetup is only open to those who have not attended before as space is limited. We will start on time and there will be no entry after 5:05pm, so please arrive early.

Core Energetics is a body-oriented psychotherapy that works with a person's emotional blocks, often held in the body. Life can be more joyful when old pain is released through energetic movement. We bring consciousness to old patterns to free ourselves and make lasting changes. Focusing on a holistic process involving body, emotion, mind and spirit, Core Energetics is a mode of healing that combines bodywork, psychotherapy and spiritual process. Core Energetics is applicable to many problems people face such as depression, anxiety, low self esteem, addiction, childhood and adult trauma, general dissatisfaction or a search for more meaning in their life. This method also works with stress management and chronic physical problems, including sexual dysfunction. A typical session consists of a combination of traditional talk therapy to bring consciousness and awareness to issues as well as various body movements to activate held energy in the body. Dr. John Pierrakos founded Core Energetics in 1978 and most forms of body psychotherapy and transpersonal work in the United States are informed by his work.
results.name: Introduction to Core Energetics (Body-Oriented Psychotherapy)

Join us (rain or shine) for our annual Dorm Dive. We will salvage a fraction of the useable and valuable items that are thrown out by NYU students at the end of the school year. This is the one event in the year where we’ll work with huge, high dumpsters. If you’re able-and-inclined, be prepared to climb in-and-out of dumpsters and possibly to lift and move heavy, awkward stuff (there’s plenty of work to do outside the dumpsters so don’t worry if climbing around in dumpsters is not your thing). Unlike other dives this will not be a tour as we tend to stay at the same dumpster throughout.
What to wear: sturdy shoes, clothes you don’t mind getting dirty. Consider bringing a pair of work or garden gloves.
What to bring: bags and other containers to tote your newfound stuff, packing tape, info on other dorm move out dates/locations.
Media: are welcome by appointment.
results.name: Freegan Dorm Dive
Soccer meetup

results.description:
Raghavendra will talk about "Deep Learning & Neural Networks"

Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) is a branch of Artificial Intelligence that has emerged with an influence from Biological Neural Networks and the goal to replicate them. Deep Learning is the process of learning an Artificial Neural Network. Deep Learning falls under the sub-branch of Artificial Intelligence called Representation Learning. Conventional ML algorithms are limited in their ability to process raw data and rather need domain specific features extracted from the data which can be hard to do. 

Representation Learning works on raw data and solves this problem internally giving Deep Learning methods an edge over conventional ML methods. Although there has been work on ANNs since 1960s, they have gained momentum again in the recent few years. The reason of this being an increase of sizes of current datasets and a boost in computational power due to parallel processing in GPUs. Deep Learning has produced some record breaking results in the past few years in various problems including hand-written digit identification, and digital object recognition (ImageNet). In my talk, I would like to discuss about how Deep Learning achieves this success, why it is better than conventional ML algorithms for many problems, challenges involved in learning a deep neural network and optimized methods for deep learning, and newer modifications to conventional neural networks (CNNs, Auto-Encoders, etc.).
results.how_to_find_us: Google maps address is 185 Hudson St. We are on the 16th floor.
results.name: Talk by Raghavendra on Deep Learning & Neural Networks

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

 Light refreshments will be served.

results.description:
Level & Prerequisites: Intended for prospective programmers and those considering enrolling in Byte Academy’s bootcamp, which includes its new medical technology program. Attendees should have Python installed prior to class.  Those who sign up for this class will have the foundation of knowledge for the second session of the evening: Problems in Healthcare Related to Methods.

This Session: You will learn about the tools and techniques needed to start you career as a professional software developer. This session will focus on methods in Python, a coding language that is greatly utilized for analyzing multiple levels of data and is often used in finance, data science, and medicine. 

This session will be taught by Rebecca Sealfon, who will also teach Byte Academy's MedTech program.  She will teach students how to apply Python tools to medicine in later classes.

About the Teacher: Ms. Sealfron is one of New York City's top female engineers and leader of New York Software Engineers and other Meetups.  She will be teaching Byte Academy's MedTech program.  

After graduating magna cum laude from Princeton University with an MS in ecology and evolutionary biology, Ms. Sealfon went on to receive an  MS in biology from Duke University then her MS in computational biology at Columbia.  She also is a national Scripps spelling bee winner and founded ResearchMatch .  Ms. Sealfon leads New York Software Engineers, New York City’s largest software engineering meetup and also Problem Solving Practice for Coders. Ms. Sealfon will utilize her technical expertise along with her extensive biology and medical background to teach the course.  


About Byte Academy: Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan, offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science, and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only one in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services, and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay nothing until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

results.description:
Community game nights are great for meeting new people, and playing lighter, low impact games. But sometimes you want to sit down for a serious session of Nations, or you want to spend 3 hours hunting down The Count in Fury of Dracula. Our Advanced game night is the perfect answer to that. The focus of this meetup is heavy Euro or Ameritrash games. It is not unusual for one of these games to last the entire time, so please try to arrive promptly at 6 (or earlier!)

If you interested in playing a particular game, sound off below so we can try to make arrangements for that to happen, and post a link to the rules so people can read them ahead of time.

There is a $5 per person cover charge at this venue, but that includes ample table space, and access to a selection of over 160 games.
results.name: Advanced Games Night

results.description:
34+ RSVPs through Eventbrite so far - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/alleyboost-how-to-build-your-startup-website-tickets-24514963917


Topics that will be covered include:

• Outsourcing vs In-House Development

• Choosing the right outsourcing partner

• Project management of Outsourced/In House Dev team deliverables

• How to hire a CTO

• How to build an internal dev team, and more!

Join us for a Web Development focused evening: 

6 – 6:15pm: Networking/Enjoy Light Refreshments and Snacks
6:15 – 6:45pm: Startup Feedback: 3 startup pitches with feedback from our panel of experts
6:45 – 7:30pm: Panel
7:30 – 7:45pm: Q/A with the Panel and the Audience
7:45 – 8pm: Business Development Networking: Mix and mingle with the audience and panelists

Panel

Jason Malki, Founder & CEO, AlleyBoost & SportsWonks (Moderator) 

Jason is the Founder and CEO of AlleyBoost, which is a startup events series that hosts startup mixers, panels, investor nights, and expos in NYC. He is also the Founder and CEO of SportsWonks which is a sports social network that is set to launch in early May. Jason holds a B.A. from Montclair State University.


Stanislav (Stan) Synko, Co-Founder & CEO, Ezetech 

Stan has been building dev teams for nearly a decade. He has experience managing product on the vendor side, as well as consulting with the client to clarify the relationship between product development the business case. After relocating to Silicone Alley and launching Ezetech in 2015, Stan has championed an MVP methodology as an effective means of solving business problems of all shapes and sizes.


Yannis Moati, Founder & CEO, HotelsByDay 

Born in Tunisia to French and Italian parents, spent his childhood living in different countries & continents, leading him to master 5 different languages and forging a solidly independent character. 

Entrepreneurship comes naturally to all independence seekers and was further honed-in when he later moved to the United States to pursue a higher education at Northeastern University in Boston. Post school, Yannis co-founded a company specialized in exotic travel, then managed a pioneering global Tour Operator company out of New York City. 

It is while traveling extensively throughout Europe that Yannis first came across the concept of selling rooms for the day. Using un-committed inventory surely sounded genial for a hotel to boost its revenues. Coming back to the USA and adopting the clever concept of the sharing economy, Yannis surrounded himself with some of the most experienced professionals in the hospitality industry to form the project of HotelsByDay.


Firat Parlak, Founder & Creative Director, Awesome 

Firat Parlak is the Founder and Creative Director behind Awesome, a UI & UX agency that specializes in crafting beautiful and engaging UI & UX design for tech startups. Firat's vision has driven the company's growth since 2011 leading to the launch of The Loft, New York's first designer exclusive co-working space, and the Startup Design School, a hands-on program teaching UI & UX design. Some of Awesome's notable clients include Luna, part of Y Combinator, NYTM, the largest Meetup group in the world, and Wanderfly, acquired by Trip Advisor. Through their experience, they have guided 130 tech startups in shaping their identities and products into successful businesses.

Volodymyr Gayovyy,  Chief Business Development Officer, Rexsoft Production 

Volodymyr is a co-founder and CBDO of a Ukrainian-based software development company RexSoft, as well as several others Ukrainian-American software and social media companies. Volodymyr serves as a bridge between the American and Ukrainian businesses to facilitate a deeper economic integration of the US and Ukraine. Volodymyr hold a Master of Engineering degree from CCNY.


Sponsors


The Farm is a coworking space located in SoHo. Specialized in Health Care Technology with an in-house Health Tech Accelerator - Blueprint Health, The Farm exposes its members to the most innovative and passionate companies and individuals NYC has to offer.


Moisan Legal P.C. utilizes technology to foster a collaborative client/attorney interaction. Our goal is to be your ongoing strategic resource and enable your business to operate effectively.

Facilitated Growth is a business and management consultancy committed to assisting entrepreneurs seeking expansion through the various phases of the business cycle.

All sales are final.

results.description:
Please check meetup site for any cancellations or changes due to weather.

---- FAQ ---- 


What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
We will power up the Major Welch, take in the sunset & socialize briefly at Perkins Tower, then descend on the AT.

We will meet in the main parking lot. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group if we have begun. You may also begin early if you would like extra time.

This is not a beginner hike. You should have some hiking experience and be getting regular exercise. While it is only four miles, there is significant elevation gain on the Major Welch.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We will do our best to reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together. The amount of time we spend at Perkins will depend upon the weather. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. There is no sweep. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain cancels and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2 - 3 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
